0.title: Man given 142-year jail sentence for raping minor girl for 2 years in Kerala
0.article_body: A 41-year-old man in Kerala's Pathanamthitta was sentenced to 142 years of rigorous imprisonment for raping a minor girl for two years from 2019 to 2021. The court said that this was the maximum punishment awarded to an accused under POCSO Act by it, adding that the man will undergo 60 years of imprisonment. He's also been fined ₹5 lakh.

1.title: BSP MLA booked as Damoh Collector says she 'abused, threatened' him
1.article_body: The Collector of Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district has accused Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) woman MLA Rambai Parihar of abusing and threatening him. Police have registered an FIR based on S Krishna Chaitanya's complaint. Parihar allegedly misbehaved with Chaitanya and used obscene words against him when she and some other women met him regarding grievances over a local issue on Friday.

2.title: 2 chain snatchers held in Hyd, valuables worth ₹2.5 lakh recovered
2.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested two chain snatchers and recovered 30 grams of gold ornaments, a motorcycle and two smartphones, all worth ₹2.5 lakh from the accused. The accused were identified as 38-year-old Pulipati Kiran and 20-year-old Siddamoni Narender. The arrests were made after a woman complained that two bike-borne miscreants snatched her gold chain and escaped.

3.title: Olympian fencer Bhavani completes hattrick of gold medals at National Games
3.article_body: Olympian fencer Bhavani Devi won her third consecutive gold medal in the women's sabre event at National Games in Gujarat on Friday. Tamil Nadu's Bhavani beat Punjab's Jagmeet Kaur 15-3 in the final. Bhavani had won gold medals in the 2011 and 2015 editions. After winning the gold, Bhavani said, "It feels great to complete my hattrick of gold medals."

4.title: Congress appoints Brijlal Khabri as party's UP state chief
4.article_body: Congress has named former BSP MP Brijlal Khabri as its new President for the party's Uttar Pradesh unit. After quitting BSP, Khabri joined Congress in 2016 and belongs to the Dalit community. The party has also appointed six regional heads namely Nasimuddin Siddiqui, Ajai Rai, Virendra Chaudhary, Nakul Dubey, Anil Yadav and Yogesh Dixit to the Uttar Pradesh Congress Committee.

5.title: Pictures show new circus-themed house with private jacuzzi for Bigg Boss 16
5.article_body: The interiors of the new Bigg Boss 16 house have been unveiled. Designed by Omung Kumar and his wife Vanitha, the house is designed as a circus and features an entrance with a joker's face, a carousel as a dining table and a captain's room with a personal jacuzzi. The bedrooms are divided into four sections, each with a theme.

6.title: Ajay Devgn's 'Maidaan' to release in February 2023
6.article_body: Ajay Devgn's 'Maidaan' is all set to release on February 17, 2023. The film, also starring Priyamani and Gajraj Rao, will be released in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam. 'Maidaan' is directed by Amit Ravindernath Sharma, who has also helmed 'Badhaai Ho' and 'Tevar'. Ajay will be seen playing the role of football coach Syed Abdul Rahim in the film.

7.title: Video of people dancing to Naatu Naatu in LA theatre surfaces, fans react
7.article_body: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' was recently screened at Chinese Theatre in Los Angeles as a part of Beyond Fest. A video showing a few people dancing to 'Naatu Naatu' close to the screen has also surfaced online. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "Foreigners dancing...Thank you SSR," while another tweeted, "Running to...front & dancing is common...in India, it's happening there also."

8.title: Cuban capital sees protests for second night over power outage
8.article_body: Cuba's capital Havana reportedly witnessed protests for a second night late on Friday over continued blackouts in several neighbourhoods following Hurricane Ian that hit Cuba earlier this week. At one such protest, protesters chanted "turn on the lights" and raised anti-government slogans, Reuters reported. On Friday, officials said power had been restored to more than 60% of consumers in Havana.

9.title: Ajay shares pic with Suriya, says 'Deeply respect his talent & love his movies'
9.article_body: Ajay Devgn took to his social media handles to share a picture with Suriya from the 68th National Film Awards ceremony, which was held at Vigyan Bhawan in New Delhi on Friday. "It was fantastic to share time with my esteemed colleague & fellow best actor award winner, @Suriya_offl. Deeply respect his talent & love his movies," Ajay wrote.

10.title: Suryakumar is one of the best T20 batters currently: SA all-rounder Parnell
10.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa second T20I, South Africa all-rounder Wayne Parnell said India's Suryakumar is probably one of the best T20 batters at the moment. "He scores 360, which is very difficult for bowlers to try and defend...He's certainly playing really good cricket," he added. Suryakumar smashed an unbeaten 50 off 33 balls in the first T20I.

11.title: BJP to hold protest against Bihar's law & order situation: Sushil Modi
11.article_body: The BJP will observe a 15-minute silent protest in Patna on Sunday against the "deteriorating law and order situation" in Bihar. The decision came following an attack on BJP leader Bablu Singh, who was shot at by the assailants in Arrah. He further alleged that people in Bihar are afraid that "Lalu Raj" has returned to the state.

12.title: Technology has become democratic in its truest sense: PM after 5G launch
12.article_body: PM Narendra Modi praised the country's Digital India campaign while launching 5G services and said that technology has become democratic in its truest sense since even the poor of the country are adopting new technologies. "Digital India is not just a name, it is a big vision for the country's development," said the PM.

13.title: Myanmar accuses rebel forces of shooting a plane with 63 passengers
13.article_body: Myanmar's military government has accused rebel forces of firing at a plane carrying 63 passengers as it was preparing to land in Loikaw on Friday. One person was reportedly injured after being hit by a bullet that penetrated the fuselage. "This kind of attack...is a war crime...People, organisations who want peace need to condemn this issue," a military spokesman said.

14.title: 10-year-old boy sexually assaulted by 3 boys aged 10-12 years in Delhi, dies
14.article_body: A 10-year-old boy, who was allegedly beaten and sexually assaulted by three minor boys aged between 10 and 12 years, passed away in a hospital in Delhi on Saturday, police said. The victim and alleged culprits are from Delhi's Seelampur area and the incident was reported on September 18. The boy was allegedly assaulted over a debt his family owed.

15.title: Nicaragua cuts diplomatic ties with Netherlands
15.article_body: Nicaragua severed all diplomatic ties with the Netherlands on Friday. The government took the decision because the "interventionist and neo-colonial" European country had "offended and keeps offending Nicaraguan families", Nicaragua's Foreign Ministry said. Earlier, Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega lashed out at the Netherlands after it said it wouldn't be funding a hospital promised long ago.

16.title: NTPC records 15.1% growth in power generation during Apr-Sept
16.article_body: State-run NTPC Limited recorded a 15.1% growth in power generation at 203.5 billion units (BU) during April-September 2022 from 176.8 BU in April to September 2021. NTPC Rihand in Uttar Pradesh was the top-performing thermal power plant with a 90.22% Plant Load Factor (PLF) during April-September 2022. NTPC coal stations' overall PLF stood at 76.3% in the said period.

17.title: Indian men's team wins 1st match, women's team loses at World Team TT C'ships
17.article_body: Indian men's team beat Uzbekistan 3-0 in their first group stage match at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in China on Saturday. Harmeet Desai, Sathiyan Gnanasekaran and Manav Thakkar won their respective matches to secure the tie. India will face Germany in their second match. Meanwhile, Indian women's team lost to Germany 2-3 in their first group stage match.

18.title: Central Railway collects ₹13.62 lakh fine in Mumbai's ticket checking drive
18.article_body: The Central Railway's Mumbai Division collected ₹13.62 lakh as fine during a one-day special ticket checking drive. The drive was conducted at 11 stations, including Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Dadar, Ghatkopar, Thane, Dombivali and Kalyan, on September 29, reports said. Reports added that 4,732 cases of irregular or unauthorised travel were detected during the check.

19.title: Youth's body found in washroom of a PG in Bengaluru after 3 days
19.article_body: The body of a man was found in the bathroom of a PG facility in Bengaluru's Govindarajanagar, nearly three days after he died. The deceased, HS Anil Kumar (24), worked as a writer at a private firm, police said. Kumar had allegedly locked the bathroom from the inside and there are no signs of physical injuries on his body.

20.title: Karnataka teacher stripped, thrashed for sexually harassing girl
20.article_body: A school teacher was stripped, dragged and thrashed by villagers for allegedly sexually harassing a girl student in Karnataka's Davanagere district on Saturday. The parents and relatives of the girl, and the villagers barged into the school and confronted the teacher, identified as Lokesh Hodigere, after learning that he harassed her after the classes.

21.title: BMC collects ₹692 cr as property tax in first six months of 2022
21.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has collected ₹692 crore as property tax in the first six months of the current financial year. The civic body has set a target of ₹7,000 crore for the financial year 2022-2023, a civic official said. "We will soon conduct an auction of the seized properties from the defaulters," said Sunil Dhamne, BMC's joint commissioner.

22.title: Couple in Brazil dye waterfall near drought-hit town for gender reveal party; probe on
22.article_body: The environment ministry in Brazil is investigating a couple after they posted a video wherein they dyed a waterfall blue for their baby's gender reveal party, leading to possible contamination of water supply of a nearby town. The Queima-Pé waterfall is the main source of water for Tangara da Serra, a town that recently suffered a long period of drought.

23.title: Never thought India would become a manufacturing hub: Sunil Mittal
23.article_body: Bharti Airtel Chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal lauded PM Narendra Modi for his initiatives such as Digital India, Make in India and Startup India and said, "I never believed manufacturing would happen in India in my lifetime, especially in electronics". He further said that it has become a reality today that India is on course to becoming a manufacturing country.

24.title: You have glasses at this age!: PM Modi to school student at 5G launch
24.article_body: PM Narendra Modi virtually interacted with students during the 5G launch event in Delhi. While talking to a girl student of Ahmedabad's Ropda Primary School, the PM said, "You have glasses at this age! You must be very studious." He further asked her what subject would she like to study with the help of technology, to which she replied, "Science."

25.title: 2 snatch gold chain during 'Kalash Shobha Yatra' in Delhi; held
25.article_body: A woman and her daughter-in-law were arrested for allegedly snatching a woman's gold chain during the 'Kalash Shobha Yatra' in Delhi. The duo was caught after the 55-year-old woman, who is a registered criminal, was identified on CCTV footage. The police are looking for the woman's daughter who is also involved, a senior police officer said.

26.title: Man tries to kiss cobra after rescuing it in Karnataka, gets bitten; video surfaces
26.article_body: A video shows a man from Karnataka trying to kiss a cobra he had just rescued. However, the snake turned its head back and bit him on the lip. The incident happened at Bommanakatte in Bhadravathi of Shivamogga district. The snake slipped away from his hands and other people can be seen trying to catch it as it slithered away.

27.title: Mehbooba Mufti seeks ailing separatist leader Altaf Shah's release
27.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti has urged the Union Home Ministry to release ailing separatist leader Altaf Shah, son-in-law of Hurriyat Conference ex-chief Syed Ali Geelani, on humanitarian grounds. Ruwa Shah, Altaf's daughter, said her father has been diagnosed with acute renal cancer and urged the government to consider shifting to a private hospital for treatment.

28.title: FIR against Cong worker for displaying PayCM poster during 'padyatra'
28.article_body: The Karnataka police have lodged an FIR against a Congress worker, Akshay Kumar, for displaying PayCM poster during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. He was also seen wearing a t-shirt with PayCM poster besides carrying a flag. Gundlupet town municipality member Kiran Gowda alleged that the Congress worker had insulted Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai.

29.title: Russia accused of 'kidnapping' head of Europe's largest nuclear plant
29.article_body: Ukrainian state nuclear company Energoatom has accused Russia of kidnapping the head of Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. Ihor Murashov was reportedly driving from the Zaporizhzhia plant to a nearby town on Friday afternoon when he was stopped, blindfolded and taken to an unknown location. "Ihor's detention...jeopardises the safety of...plant," Energoatom chief Petro Kotin said.

30.title: Woman drug peddler held in Hyderabad, 44 kg marijuana seized
30.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested a woman drug peddler, Laxmi Bai, from Mahatma Gandhi Bus Station on Friday and seized 44 kg marijuana worth ₹3.5 lakh. According to the police, the accused was transporting and supplying marijuana to customers in Maharashtra's Parbhani. Laxmi along with her accomplice, Rahul Kokate, visited Odisha's Malkangiri and procured 22 marijuana packets wrapped in brown tape.

31.title: Part of roof falls on cheering fans at football stadium in Chile, video surfaces
31.article_body: Several cheering fans were injured after a section of a roof at a football stadium crashed on them during a training session hosted by Chilean club Colo Colo on Friday. Videos of the incident also surfaced online. Meanwhile, Colo Colo said that a group of people climbed onto a structure for advertising causing part of the roof to collapse.

32.title: New Congress chief will be a 'puppet' of Gandhi family: Sushil Modi
32.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi has criticised the process of the Congress Presidential election, claiming that whoever is elected will be a "puppet" of the Gandhi family. Friday was the last day for filing nominations for the election of the Congress President, where a total of three leaders staked their claim for the post.

33.title: Dengue cases cross 20,000-mark in West Bengal in 2022
33.article_body: Dengue cases in West Bengal so far in 2022 have crossed the 20,000-mark. This comes after 924 new confirmed cases were detected in the state on Friday. As many as 4,744 fresh cases were recorded in the past week. The state Health Department has asked its staff not to leave their places of posting without prior notice.

34.title: Hrithik's Vedha is a lion, tiger & panther all rolled into one: Johar
34.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Twitter and praised Hrithik Roshan's performance in his recent film 'Vikram Vedha'. He said that Hrithik is "the ultimate leading man of the mainstream movies". "Hrithik Roshan is a force of nature...from his sinister smile to his solid swag...His VEDHA is a lion, tiger and panther all rolled into one!!! WOW," Johar further wrote.

35.title: Water stock in lakes sufficient, no water cuts till next monsoon: BMC
35.article_body: Since the water stock in lakes is sufficient, there will be no water cuts till next monsoon in Mumbai, according to BMC officials. On Friday, the seven lakes that supply water to the city were 98.50% full. In 2018, when rainfall was below average, lakes had 91% stock and the city faced a 10% water cut from November to June.

36.title: Many made fun of my vision of Aatmanirbhar Bharat: PM at 5G launch
36.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing people during the launch of 5G technology, said the low cost of devices can only be achieved through Aatmanirbhar Bharat. Adding that "many people made fun" of his vision of Aatmanirbhar Bharat, he further said that today, number of phone manufacturing units in India is over 200 while in 2014, there were only two units.

37.title: Govt employee poses as judge before AAP leader in Punjab, 2 arrested
37.article_body: A Punjab government employee who allegedly posed as a judge before an AAP leader has been arrested, police said. A total of three government employees were booked in the case, among whom one was arrested on Wednesday, police added. The accused, over a call, had congratulated the AAP leader for his elevation as joint secretary of the AAP's SC wing.

38.title: Thousands of Russian troops in Lyman surrounded: Ukraine
38.article_body: Thousands of Russian troops in the town of Lyman have been surrounded by Ukrainian forces in an ongoing operation, Ukraine's military said on Saturday. The town has served as a logistics and transport hub for Russian forces operating in the northern Donetsk region. "Lyman is important because it is the next step towards the liberation of...Donbas," the military added.

39.title: UPI transactions rise by over 3% at 678 crore in September: NPCI
39.article_body: UPI transactions surged by over 3% in September from that in August, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) data showed. In value terms, 678 crore transactions in the last month translate to transactions worth ₹11.16 lakh crore, up from ₹10.73 lakh crore in August. In July, India processed 628 crore UPI transactions worth ₹10.62 lakh crore.

40.title: No petrol, diesel in Delhi without PUC from Oct 25: Environment minister
40.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said no petrol and diesel will be provided without a PUC (pollution under control) certificate of the vehicle at petrol pumps from October 25. "Vehicular emission is one of the key contributors to rising pollution in Delhi," he added. Delhi government will launch its 24x7 war room on October 3 to combat pollution, Rai stated.

41.title: KN Tripathi's nomination form for Congress President poll rejected
41.article_body: Former Jharkhand minister KN Tripathi's nomination form for Congress President election has been rejected, Congress' Central Election Authority chief Madhusudan Mistry said on Saturday. His form did not meet the norms and had signature-related issues, he added. Mistry further revealed that Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor are currently the only contenders for the post of Congress President.

42.title: Woman stabs brother-in-law to death during a quarrel in Thane
42.article_body: A woman allegedly stabbed her brother-in-law to death during a quarrel in the Mafatlal slum colony in Kalwa, Thane. The accused, Priyanka Survade (23), used to live with her husband and the family of the deceased, Sagar Survade, in the same residence, police said. Sagar was allegedly an alcoholic and used to fight with his wife, police added.

43.title: Ebola kills doctor in Uganda, 1st health worker killed in latest outbreak
43.article_body: A 37-year-old Tanzanian doctor working in Uganda has died after contracting Ebola, Uganda's Health Minister Jane Aceng said on Saturday. Mohammed Ali, who had tested positive for Ebola on September 26, is the first health worker to be killed by the disease in the latest outbreak in the country. Ugandan authorities announced the outbreak of hemorrhagic fever on September 20.

44.title: Meta to continue paying for ex-COO Sandberg's personal security after her exit
44.article_body: Meta will provide personal security services to former COO Sheryl Sandberg even after her departure over "continuing threats to her safety". Meta expects to continue to pay for security services at Sandberg's residences and during her personal travel till June 30 next year. Sandberg, who had joined the company in 2008, marked her last day at Meta on September 30.

45.title: Activision Chief Compliance Officer Frances Townsend steps down
45.article_body: Activision Blizzard's Chief Compliance Officer Frances Townsend has stepped down from her role after nearly two years. She will now work as an advisor to the video game company's board and its CEO Bobby Kotick. Townsend was criticised last year for calling claims mentioned in a lawsuit against alleged sexism at Activision "factually incorrect, old and out of context".

46.title: Delhi govt collects ₹768 cr from excise duty, VAT, licence fee in 30 days
46.article_body: The Delhi government has collected ₹768 crore excise revenue in 30 days. This revenue has been collected from excise duty, VAT and licence fee under the current excise regime. The excise department official said the ₹768 crore figure includes about ₹460 crore from excise duty, ₹140 crore from VAT and revenue from the licence fee.

47.title: Raja Singh's supporters offer prayers at Hyd temple for his release
47.article_body: Around 50 supporters of suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh offered prayers for his release at the Bhagyalaxmi temple near Charminar in Hyderabad on Friday. They participated in 'maha aarti' and raised slogans like "Raja bhai tum sangharsh karo hum tumhare saath hai" (you fight, we are with you). The Goshamahal MLA is in jail for his remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

48.title: Cyber awareness workshop for women and children conducted in Noida
48.article_body: A cyber awareness workshop was conducted at the Gautam Buddha Nagar Police Commissionerate on Friday. It was attended by over 350 participants, including 194 students and several women police personnel. The participants were informed about ways to keep their personal information safe from cyber frauds. "The attendees were informed about the helpline number," said an official.

49.title: 5 people rescued after fire breaks out at call centre in Noida
49.article_body: A fire broke out at a call centre in Noida Sector 3 on Friday morning, however, no one was injured in the incident. Five people who were trapped on the second floor of the call centre were rescued using hydraulic ladders, fire department officials said. Four fire tenders were rushed to the spot after the incident was reported, officials added.

50.title: Tharoor to start campaign for Cong Presidential polls from Nagpur today
50.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor will start his campaign for the party President's election by visiting the Deekshabhoomi monument in Nagpur today, where he will pay his tribute to Dr Ambedkar and later address a press conference. On Sunday, he will visit Mahatma Gandhi's Sevagram Ashram in Wardha at 9 am. He will hold meetings with senior party leaders and workers.

51.title: Salman shares pic with body double after he dies, says 'Thank you for being there with me'
51.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to social media to share a photo with his body double Sagar Pandey following his demise. "I thank you from the bottom of my heart for being there with me. May your soul rest in peace brother Sagar. Thank you, RIP Sagar Pandey," he wrote. Sagar passed away on Friday due to a heart attack.

52.title: GST collections cross ₹1.4 lakh cr for 7th straight month, up 26% in Sept
52.article_body: The gross GST revenue collection in September surged by 26% to ₹1,47,686 crore, Finance Ministry said. This is the seventh month in a row that the monthly GST revenues have crossed the ₹1.4 lakh crore mark. Total revenue of the Centre and states after regular settlements in September 2022 stood at ₹57,151 crore for CGST and ₹59,216 crore for SGST.

53.title: Varanasi university removes guest lecturer over FB post on Navratri
53.article_body: Varanasi-based Mahatma Gandhi Kashi Vidyapith (MGKV) dismissed a guest lecturer over his Facebook post on Navratri. "Instead of fasting for nine days during Navratri, it will be better for women to read the Indian Constitution and Hindu Code Bill," Mithilesh Kumar Gautam had written on Facebook. He has also been barred from entering the university campus.

54.title: Allahabad High Court stays arrest of SP leader Azam Khan, son
54.article_body: Allahabad High Court on Friday stayed Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Azam Khan and his son Abdullah Azam Khan's arrest in connection with a 2017 case involving the recovery of some Rampur civic body machines from the Mohammad Ali Jauhar University campus. Police had earlier lodged an FIR against Khan, his son and four others in the case.

55.title: He's right: Clooney on Pitt calling him 'most handsome man in the world'
55.article_body: Actor George Clooney in an interview was asked what he thought about Brad Pitt recently calling him the most handsome man in the world. The 61-year-old actor said, "Well, he's right about that. Let's face it. He's right." Pitt and Clooney have worked together in several films, including 'Ocean's Eleven', 'Ocean's Twelve' and 'Burn After Reading'.

56.title: Telecom industry is foundation of Digital India: Ashwini Vaishnaw
56.article_body: Union Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw called the telecom industry a sunrise industry and said, "Telecom is the gateway, the foundation of Digital India. It is the mode to bring digital services to every person." For last mile connectivity, a sum of ₹35,000 crore has been sanctioned that will take 5G to every nook and corner of the country, he added.

57.title: Stop and smell the roses: Elon Musk on advice to younger self
57.article_body: Elon Musk was asked during Tesla's 'AI Day' event that what advice he'd give to his younger self. Replying, the 51-year-old said, "I'd say to twenty- or twenty-something me, 'just stop and smell the roses occasionally'." Recalling the time he was developing an early SpaceX rocket on an island, he said, "I should have had a drink on the beach!"

58.title: Govt job mindset impediment to startup culture: Jitendra Singh
58.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh said that the government job mindset is proving to be an impediment to the startup culture. He said that the startup culture is yet to fully catch up to the imagination of entrepreneurs in some north Indian states as against those down south, which have taken a lead by engaging a chain of globally recognised startups.

59.title: Ghaziabad man kills wife, 15-yr-old daughter after dispute over water supply
59.article_body: A 42-year-old man allegedly killed his 36-year-old wife and 15-year-old daughter after a fight in Ghaziabad. Reports said that the couple used to fight a lot. Before the murder, they had fought after the wife had shut off water supply. "The wife was found dead in her room while [the daughter's] body was found on the terrace," police said.

60.title: Ex-Trump aide jailed after admitting possession of child sexual abuse images
60.article_body: Adam Hageman, an official who worked in US Commerce Department during ex-President Donald Trump's administration, has been jailed for five-and-a-half years after pleading guilty to possession of child sexual abuse images. He was arrested in November 2020. Hageman was accused of "sharing a child pornography video and commenting several times on sexually abusing children" in an online group chat.

61.title: Marvel and DC director James Gunn marries actress Jennifer Holland, shares pics
61.article_body: Marvel and DC director James Gunn got married to his longtime girlfriend, actress Jennifer Holland in Aspen, Colorado. Sharing photos from the wedding, he wrote, "After over 7 years together, I finally married the love of my life." "What an incredible, beautiful, stunning day surrounded by the most wonderful family and friends in the world," James added.

62.title: Bella Hadid gets dress spray-painted on her body live on runway, video surfaces
62.article_body: At a fashion show in Paris, a dress was spray-painted on model Bella Hadid’s body in front of the audience from start to finish. A video of it also showed how a woman cut a slit in the dress, following which Hadid walked the runway. The dress was made of Fabrican, a spray-on material that hardens into a wearable textile.

63.title: Caught drunk driving, man removes clothes before police in Hyderabad
63.article_body: A man reportedly removed his clothes before the police after he was caught for drunk driving in Hyderabad's Malakpet area on Friday. Initially, the man tried to escape checking but after getting caught, he got into an argument with the police. He alleged that he resorted to the act of undressing himself as the police had abused him.

64.title: Punjab man kills self after lover slaps him for asking to return money
64.article_body: A 30-year-old man died by suicide by consuming poison after his lover refused to return the money he had given to her in Punjab's Ludhiana. The lover also grabbed him by his collar and slapped him. The deceased's father said that his son cried after that and said that he felt insulted and would die.

65.title: Bihar doctor held for making liquor from medicines escapes Excise Dept custody
65.article_body: A doctor who had been arrested for allegedly making liquor from medicines in Bihar escaped the Excise Department's custody, reports said. He was arrested when the Excise Department officials found a stock of medicines that he was using to make liquor. An official said that the accused was sitting at the police station with tied hands but managed to escape.

66.title: Nitish Kumar focused on uniting the Opposition: Tejashwi Yadav
66.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav has put an end to speculations about Chief Minister Nitish Kumar contesting Lok Sabha polls in 2024, saying that Kumar is focused on uniting the Opposition. "He (CM Nitish Kumar) is the CM and we're working under his guidance...He has no desire to become the Prime Minister," said Tejashwi.

67.title: 10-year-old boy dies weeks after 3 friends sodomise him in Delhi
67.article_body: A 10-year-old boy died after he was sodomised on September 18 by three of his friends, aged 10-12 years, in Delhi's Seelampur area, police said on Saturday. The victim was admitted to Lok Nayak Hospital on September 22. "The boy passed away owing to complications from his injuries. Two accused boys (have been) apprehended," Delhi Police said.

68.title: I used to survived on a biscuit, walked 7 km to give auditions: Actor Darshan
68.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar said that he used to survive on a biscuit and walked for around seven kilometres to give auditions. "I used to carry an extra t-shirt and deodorant to give multiple auditions. Those were the days when I learned a lot. I used to do dubbing to run my livelihood," he added.

69.title: Minor boy who was sodomised by 3 friends dies in Delhi hospital
69.article_body: A minor boy who was allegedly assaulted and sodomised by his three minor friends died at a hospital in Delhi on Saturday, police said. The victim and the friends are all aged between 10 to 12. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal also confirmed the news in a tweet which said that the boy's killers "must be punished severely".

70.title: World Bank to provide $530 mn additional aid to Ukraine amid war
70.article_body: The World Bank said it'll provide an additional $530 million to help Ukraine meet urgent needs created by Russia's invasion of the country. The aid is supported by the UK ($500 million) and Denmark ($30 million), it added. World Bank has mobilised nearly $13 billion in emergency financing for Ukraine to date, of which $11 billion has been fully disbursed.

71.title: 5G like 'Digital Kamdhenu', heavenly cow that grants whatever we desire: Ambani
71.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani compared 5G technology to a "Digital Kamdhenu" and said, "It will not be an exaggeration to say that 5G is...the heavenly cow that grants whatever we desire." He added, "The rollout of 5G in India is not an ordinary event in India's telecom history. It carries...keen expectations and...high aspirations of 1.4 billion Indians."

72.title: Video shows PM Modi getting 5G demo from Jio Chairman Akash Ambani
72.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was provided with a demonstration of 'True 5G' devices by Reliance Jio’s Chairman Akash Ambani on Saturday at India Mobile Congress. Accompanied by Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, PM Modi was seen trying the 'Jio Glass' with Akash Ambani assisting him.

73.title: Indian startup market behind China's but has potential: Facebook Co-founder
73.article_body: Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin said that even though the Indian startup market is still behind China's in areas such as ease of asset exits and market liquidity, it has "tremendous potential". He further said that with a better macroeconomic environment and a more mature market, the Indian startups market would be one "to bet on, combined with Southeast Asia".

74.title: Woman sexually abused, cheated of ₹66 lakh in Pune; 2 arrested
74.article_body: Pune police arrested two persons after a woman was allegedly cheated of ₹66 lakh on pretext of buying land and was sexually abused over the period between July 2021 and January 2022. According to investigators, one of the accused apparently sexually exploited the woman on multiple occasions and threatened to kill her. The woman had lodged an FIR on Thursday.

75.title: HDFC Ltd hikes lending rate by 50 bps, EMIs to go up
75.article_body: Mortgage lender HDFC Limited increased its lending rate by 50 basis points on Friday after the Reserve Bank of India hiked the benchmark interest rate. The new rate comes into effect on October 1 and the home loan EMIs of lender's customers will also increase. This is the seventh time HDFC has hiked the rate in the last five months.

76.title: 3 car passengers killed as apple-laden truck overturns on it in Shimla
76.article_body: At least three passengers of a car were killed after an apple-laden truck overturned on it in Shimla's Chharabra in Himachal Pradesh on Saturday morning. The driver of the truck suffered minor injuries and has been arrested. Himachal CM Jairam Thakur expressed his condolences and tweeted, "May God give peace to the departed souls and strength to the bereaved families."

77.title: Pak govt's Twitter account withheld in India due to 'legal demand'
77.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Pakistani government was withheld on Saturday with the social media company saying that the move came in response to a legal demand by the Centre. It is yet to be ascertained as to what prompted the move against their official Twitter handle. The account was withheld earlier in July also but was later reactivated.

78.title: I am not in a hurry to become CM: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav
78.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav reacted to RJD leader Jagadanand Singh's claim that the former would become state CM in 2023, saying, "I have no personal ambition nor am I in a hurry." He also advised RJD leaders to not speak on the matter. "We must remain focused on dislodging from power fascist forces represented by the BJP," he added.

79.title: 3rd party loan recovery agents should be on right side of law: RBI
79.article_body: Clarifying that the RBI is not against the outsourcing of recovery activities by banks, RBI Deputy Governor MK Jain said, "It should be on the right side of the law". He was referring to the incident of a pregnant woman being allegedly crushed to death under a tractor that was being taken away by Mahindra Finance's recovery agents in Jharkhand.

80.title: We may have started late, but will finish first: Mukesh Ambani on 5G in India
80.article_body: Asia's second-richest person Mukesh Ambani, speaking at the launch event of 5G technology services in the country, said, "India may have started late, but...we will finish first" by rolling out 5G across the nation. He said that 5G will help India achieve the goal of $40-trillion economy by 2047 and help increase per capita income from $2,000 to $20,000.

81.title: Putin's latest actions most serious escalation since war began: NATO
81.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg has accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of provoking "the most serious escalation" of the war in Ukraine since it began in February. "We've the combination of the mobilisation in Russia, combined with the...dangerous nuclear rhetoric, and then...illegal annexation," Stoltenberg said. The escalation will not deter NATO from supporting Ukraine, he added.

82.title: Suvendu accuses Mamata-led WB govt of 'illegally diverting funds'
82.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari has written a letter to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in which he accused state CM Mamata Banerjee-led government of illegally diverting funds provided by the Centre. Adhikari claimed that a major portion of the funds was transferred to the State Emergency Relief Fund which is controlled by the CM's Office.

83.title: PM Modi drives car in Europe remotely from India using 5G, video surfaces
83.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday conducted test drive of a car in Europe remotely from India using 5G technology at the India Mobile Congress 2022. He drove the remote controlled car, which was set up to navigate a closed indoor course in Sweden. Sharing a picture of PM conducting the test, Union Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted, "India driving the world."

84.title: Nord Stream leaks likely single largest methane release ever: UN
84.article_body: The UN Environment Programme said the ruptures on the Nord Stream natural gas pipeline system under the Baltic Sea have led to what's "likely the largest emission" of climate-damaging methane ever recorded. According to environmental data company GHGSat, the leak rate from one of four rupture points was 22,920 kg/h, equivalent to burning about 2,86,000 kg of coal every hour.

85.title: Gurugram may host some G20 meetings in 2023: Official
85.article_body: A team from the Ministry of External Affairs held a meeting with local officers in Gurugram on Friday. The city is likely to host a few G20 meetings after India assumes the Presidency of the group on December 1st this year. "Four to five meetings are likely to be held in the city, involving 300-400 foreign delegates," an official said.

86.title: 5 RSS leaders in Kerala get Y security over threat from PFI: Report
86.article_body: Five RSS leaders in Kerala have been given Y security cover by the central government over suspected threats from banned organisation PFI, reported PTI quoting sources. The CRPF's VIP security wing has been put up to the task. The leaders are believed to be targets of PFI as per documents recovered by central investigative agencies during recent raids.

87.title: Priyanka Chopra interviews US VP Harris, discusses mansplaining, abortion rights
87.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra on Friday interviewed the US Vice President Kamala Harris at the women's leadership forum organised by the Democratic National Committee in Washington. Chopra and Harris discussed various topics including mansplaining, reproductive rights and gun laws. Pointing to the silence in the room, Chopra joked, "Do you hear that sound? That is the sound of no mansplaining, ladies."

88.title: Man kills 8-year-old grandniece for refusing to bring tobacco in MP
88.article_body: A 60-year-old man allegedly killed his eight-year-old grandniece with an axe and buried her body in a heap of fodder in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, a police official said on Friday. The incident occurred after the grandniece "refused to bring tobacco from a nearby shop despite repeated requests", the SP said. The accused has been arrested, the SP added.

89.title: Mallikarjun Kharge resigns as Rajya Sabha Leader of Opposition
89.article_body: In line with Congress' resolution of 'one person, one post', senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha after filing nomination for his party's President post. He submitted his resignation to party chief Sonia Gandhi. As the head of the Congress parliamentary party, Gandhi will have to appoint a new Leader of Opposition.

90.title: Ex-Maharashtra minister allegedly threatens to kill man; FIR filed
90.article_body: An FIR has been filed after former Maharashtra minister and NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal and two others allegedly threatened to kill a man, an official said. The man said that he was threatened for "forwarding two videos to Bhujbal, in which the latter allegedly spoke against Hindu religion", an official said. Bhujbal is currently the MLA for Yeola.

91.title: Which 13 Indian cities will first get the newly-launched 5G services?
91.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday launched 5G services in selected cities in India. While the service will be available to the entire country in a couple of years, the network will be launched in 13 Indian cities first. The cities are, namely, Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chandigarh, Chennai, Delhi, Gandhinagar, Gurugram, Hyderabad, Jamnagar, Kolkata, Lucknow, Mumbai and Pune.

92.title: Pune Police busts call centre of instant loan apps, 18 arrested
92.article_body: Pune Police busted a call centre of instant loan apps and arrested 18 persons for issuing threats and harassing defaulters. Police received 4,778 complaints from 2020 to 2022 in which people claimed they were abused and harassed, Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said. "These apps seek access to the camera, photos, contacts and storage on mobile phones," Gupta added.

93.title: Woman touches feet of Arun Govil who played Lord Ram in Ramayan, video surfaces
93.article_body: A woman was seen touching the feet of actor Arun Govil, who played Lord Ram in the television serial 'Ramayan'. She was seen bowing down in front of him at the Mumbai Airport while the actor stood with folded hands. A video of the incident has surfaced online. The woman also got pictures clicked with the actor.

94.title: Parag is trying to please people: Musk to Dorsey after offering to buy Twitter
94.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered to acquire Twitter, a text conversation between him and Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey surfaced. Musk wrote to Dorsey, "Parag is just moving far too slowly and trying to please people who will not be happy no matter what he does." Dorsey replied, "At least it became clear that you can't work together."

95.title: mCaffeine announces Buy 1 Get 1 Sale & free iPhones on its 6th birthday
95.article_body: Natural & 100% vegan brand mCaffeine has announced its Buy 1 Get 1 Sale to celebrate its 6th birthday. With offers as big as BOGO days, chances to win big prizes like iPhone 14 every day and a sponsored trip to Goa, the brand is going bigger than ever, it shared, adding that the sale goes live for 6 days.

96.title: Cong only party in country that elects its President: Jairam Ramesh
96.article_body: Former Union Minister Jairam Ramesh praised the Congress and said that it's the only party in the country that elects its President. "The other parties do not have elections to this effect. Our party has a system. It makes no difference whether the elections are won by Rajya Sabha leader Mallikarjun Kharge or former Union Minister Shashi Tharoor," said Ramesh.

97.title: Burkina Faso's military leader ousted in second coup this year
97.article_body: A group of Burkina Faso army soldiers announced that the country's coup leader-turned-President, Lieutenant Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba, has been ousted. Captain Ibrahim Traore, the new leader of Burkina Faso, said that Damiba was removed due to his inability to deal with a worsening Islamist insurgency. Damiba had ousted former President Roch Kabore in January citing the same reason.

98.title: PM Narendra Modi launches 5G services in selected cities in India
98.article_body: PM Narendra Modi launched 5G services in selected cities at India Mobile Congress on Saturday. The service is expected to cover the entire country over the next couple of years. In August, the Centre received bids worth ₹1.50 lakh crore from the spectrum auction. Reliance Jio, Adani Group, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea were the four participants in the auction.

99.title: India's forex reserves record steepest weekly fall in 6 months
99.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $8.134 billion to $537.518 billion for the week ended September 23, the RBI data showed. This is the steepest weekly fall in six months and reserves have fallen for eight straight weeks now. This decline was due to a dip in the foreign currency assets which decreased by $7.688 billion to $477.212 billion.

100.title: Telangana hikes quota for STs to 10% in educational institutes, govt jobs
100.article_body: K Chandrashekar Rao-led Telangana government has hiked the reservation for Scheduled Tribes (STs) from 6% to 10% in educational institutes and state government services with effect from October 1. The overall quota in the state for various categories has now gone up to 54%. A bill on the 10% reservation was passed by the Telangana Assembly in April 2017.

101.title: India's core sectors grew 3.3% in August, lowest in 9 months
101.article_body: India's core sectors grew 3.3% in August, which is the lowest in nine months. It had grown 4.5% in July, while in August last year, it was 12.2%. Except for crude oil and natural gas, which contracted by 3.3% and 0.9%, respectively, all sectors including coal, refinery products, electricity, fertilisers, cement and steel posted growth.

102.title: Fiscal deficit widens to ₹5.42 lakh crore in April-August period
102.article_body: India's fiscal deficit for the April-August period of the current financial year touched ₹5.42 lakh crore or 32.6% of annual estimates, government data showed on Friday. In the year-ago period, the fiscal deficit had touched 31.1% of the annual estimates. Net tax receipts surged to about ₹7 lakh crore, while total expenditure was ₹13.9 lakh crore.

103.title: We condemn continued targeting of innocent students: India on Kabul terror attack
103.article_body: India has condemned the terror attack at Kaaj Educational Center in Kabul on Friday that killed at least 19 people and injured many others. "We are saddened by yesterday's terror attack...and extend our condolences to the families of the victims. India strongly condemns the continued targeting of innocent students at educational places," External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said.

104.title: Twitch to charge viewers $100 to pin chat messages for 2.5 minutes
104.article_body: Twitch is testing a paid feature called 'Elevated Chat' that will allow viewers to get their chat messages highlighted for a specific amount of time. The feature comes with five different pricing tiers, ranging from $5 for 30 seconds to $100 for 2.5 minutes. Twitch will give streamers a 70/30 cut of revenue from elevated chats after taxes and fees.

105.title: Pune police rescue 3 women after busting prostitution racket
105.article_body: Pune police rescued three women after busting a prostitution racket by laying a trap using decoy customers. A person who trafficked women was also arrested. A police inspector said that the modus operandi was that a person called the customers and sent them photos of women. Phone, cash and an autorickshaw worth a total of ₹62,500 were seized, officials said.

106.title: Centre extends AFSPA in several districts of Nagaland, Arunachal
106.article_body: The central government extended the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act or AFSPA in nine districts and 16 police stations in four other districts of Nagaland from October 1 to March 30, 2023. It also extended AFSPA in three districts of Arunachal Pradesh, including Tirap, Changlang and Longding, and areas falling within the jurisdiction of Namsai and Mahadevpur police stations.

107.title: Avalanche hits mountains surrounding Kedarnath temple, no damage to temple
107.article_body: An avalanche hit the Himalayan mountains surrounding the Kedarnath Temple, news agency ANI reported. Shri Badrinath-Kedarnath Temple Committee President, Ajendra Ajay, said that no damage was done to the Kedarnath temple due to the avalanche. ANI shared a video of the incident, showing the movement of snow during the avalanche at a faraway mountain.

108.title: I kinda don't think I should be the boss of anyone: Musk told Twitter CEO in a text
108.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk told Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal in a text message that he "kinda thinks" he shouldn't be the "boss of anyone". Musk told Agrawal, "Frankly, I hate doing mgmt stuff...But I love helping solve technical/product design problems." The texts were released as part of the ongoing documentation ahead of their trial starting October 17.

109.title: Girl who received 'condom' remark offered free supply of pads, funding for education
109.article_body: Bihar's Riya Kumari, who was told "next you will want free condoms" by an IAS officer, has been offered a year's worth of free sanitary pads. "A small token of...appreciation for her conviction to put an end to...bloody hypocrisy around menstruation," CEO of a Delhi-based company said. The company will also bear cost of her education fees through her graduation.

110.title: MP HC sees violent protests as lawyer kills self after pleading in court
110.article_body: Madhya Pradesh High Court witnessed violent protests by advocates as a lawyer allegedly died by suicide after pleading in the Jabalpur bench. Some policemen suffered injuries, Jabalpur SP said. The protesting lawyers allegedly vandalised courtrooms and set ablaze a senior advocate's office. This comes after the deceased allegedly had an altercation with a judge during a bail plea hearing.

111.title: 4 accused to be tried as adults in Hyderabad Jubilee Hills gangrape
111.article_body: Four of the five minors accused in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gangrape case will be tried as adults, said a Juvenile Justice Board on Friday. The accused had offered lift to a 17-year-old girl and then took turns raping her inside a car. The Principal Magistrate noted that the four minors were capable of understanding the consequences of their actions.

112.title: Gadkari asks Mercedes to produce affordable cars locally, says 'Even I can't afford them'
112.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged Mercedes-Benz to produce more cars locally and emphasised reducing costs. Speaking at the company's event, he said, "You increase the production, only then is it possible to reduce cost. We're middle-class people, even I can't afford your car." The company has launched EQS 580 4MATIC in India, its first locally assembled electric car.

113.title: 9 foreigners arrested as protests continue in Iran over Amini's death
113.article_body: Iran's Intelligence Ministry said on Friday that nine foreign nationals had been arrested in connection with the ongoing protests over the death of a 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini in police custody. The citizens from Germany, Poland, Italy, France, the Netherlands, Sweden and other countries were detained "during the riots or while plotting in the background", the ministry added.

114.title: Telangana CM KCR visits Yadadri temple, offers gold worth ₹52 lakh
114.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Friday visited the Sri Lakshminarasimha Swamy Temple in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district along with his family members. On Rao's behalf, his grandson offered a cheque of over ₹52 lakh to the temple as a donation for buying 1.16 kg of gold. The gold will be used for gold plating the "gopuram" at the temple.

115.title: Massive fire breaks out at Gurugram's Global Foyer Mall, several fire tenders rushed
115.article_body: A massive fire broke out at the Global Foyer Mall situated on the Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Saturday morning. The fire reportedly broke out on the first floor of the mall. Several fire tenders were rushed to the site and officials said that the fire has been brought under control. No casualties were reported in the incident.

116.title: North Korea fires 4th round of missile tests in 1 week
116.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles on Saturday, marking the fourth round of such a test in a week. South Korean military said it spotted the launches 18 minutes apart. Notably, amid North Korea's missile tests, the navies of South Korea, the US and Japan staged trilateral anti-submarine exercises on Friday for the first time in five years.

117.title: Introducing India’s first ever investment festival: ET Money
117.article_body: ET Money has launched the Great Indian Investment Festival that promises rewards worth ₹20 lakh for tax savings and investments. Users can get flat 60% off on Genius membership, up to ₹2 lakh of referral rewards and assured Amazon vouchers. Lucky draw winners will also get iPhone 14 Plus, iPad Air 5 and Royal Enfield Interceptor, said the brand.

118.title: Musk unveils prototype of Tesla's humanoid robot, to cost less than a car
118.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk unveiled a prototype of humanoid robot, dubbed 'Optimus', during the company's AI Day event on Saturday. During the event, the robot walked onstage, waved hello and danced. "The robot can actually do a lot more...We just didn't want it to fall on its face," said Musk, adding that it's expected to cost less than a car.

119.title: 6-year-old beaten to death for eating apple from 'prasad' in Bihar
119.article_body: A six-year-old boy was allegedly beaten to death for eating an apple from 'prasad' or offering meant for Goddess Durga at a school in Bihar's Gaya. "The owners of the school kept Vivek in a room and brutally assaulted him. After the physical assault, they threw him outside the premises," said the victim's grandfather. Police have arrested the accused.

120.title: Robinhood to close 5 more offices in US, no worker to be laid off
120.article_body: Robinhood Markets on Friday said it will partially or completely shut down five more offices in the US as part of its restructuring plan to cut expenses. The California-based brokerage company said the closures, which will result in restructuring charges of around $45 million, will be done without any job cuts. Robinhood fired around 23% of its employees in August.

121.title: No direct trains from Noida Electronic City to Dwarka Sec 21 on Sunday till 2 pm: DMRC
121.article_body: No direct Metro trains will be available from Noida Electronic City to Dwarka/Dwarka Sector-21 on Sunday till 2 PM due to track maintenance work between Yamuna Bank and Akshardham stations, DMRC said. "Train services...will be operated in two loops- regular services from Dwarka Sector-21 to Yamuna Bank in one loop...Yamuna Bank to Noida Electronic City in another loop," DMRC added.

122.title: Price of 19-kg LPG cylinder cut by ₹25.50, new price list for cities released
122.article_body: Oil marketing companies have announced a price cut of ₹25.50 for a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder with immediate effect. With the latest revision, the 19-kg LPG cylinder now costs ₹1,859 in Delhi, ₹1,959 in Kolkata, ₹1,811.50 in Mumbai and ₹2,009.50 in Chennai. Earlier in September, the cost of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was slashed by up to ₹100.

123.title: Intel's self-driving technology firm Mobileye files for IPO in US
123.article_body: Mobileye, an Intel-owned firm that makes chips and software for self-driving cars, has filed a prospectus in US to get listed on Nasdaq. While the prospectus didn't mention price range for the proposed listing, Bloomberg earlier reported that Intel expects the IPO to value Mobileye at up to $30 billion. Intel acquired the Israeli company in 2017 for $15.3 billion.

124.title: Will concrete every inch of Mumbai roads in 3 years: BMC Commissioner
124.article_body: The BMC Commissioner, Iqbal Chahal, informed the Bombay HC on Friday that within three years, every inch of Mumbai's roads, lanes and bylanes will be concreted. However, he added that Mumbai will not be pothole-free until the BMC becomes the single planning authority to look after maintenance work. The civic body also submitted a list of the 20 worst roads.

125.title: New COVID-19 cases drop below 100 in Bengaluru, no deaths reported
125.article_body: Bengaluru reported 93 new COVID-19 infections on Friday, taking the cumulative case count to 18,72,027, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,248, while the infection positivity rate stood at 1.18%.

126.title: Congress engages in appeasement politics: K'taka CM Bommai
126.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress leader Siddaramaiah for demanding a ban on the RSS, claiming that the Congress engages in appeasement politics. "Congress has no basis for asking why PFI has been banned because it was the same party that had withdrawn the cases booked against PFI...The RSS has built several institutions for the poor and downtrodden," said Bommai.

127.title: Preventive detention is a serious invasion of personal liberty: SC
127.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday observed that "preventive detention is a serious invasion of personal liberty". It said that due to this, whatever "little safeguards" the Constitution and law authorising the detention provides are of "utmost importance". The court made the observation while setting aside the preventive detention of a man under Prevention of Illicit Traffic in NDPS Act, 1988.

128.title: Mexican govt suffers major data hack; President's health issues revealed
128.article_body: The Mexican government on Friday said it had suffered a major cyber hack. The hack revealed personal details about Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador's heart condition that led to his hospitalisation in January. According to media reports, the hack accessed six terabytes of data from the Defence Ministry, including information about criminal figures, and transcripts of communications.

129.title: PM Modi skips using mic to obey loudspeaker norms, apologises to Raj rally
129.article_body: PM Narendra Modi avoided using a microphone to address a rally in Rajasthan on Friday as he reached late and said he didn't want to violate rules by using microphones and loudspeakers after 10 pm. PM Modi said, "I reached a little late. Now it's 10 pm….I apologise for the delay...I want to promise you that I'll come here again."

130.title: US imposes first-ever sanction on Indian company for oil trade with Iran
130.article_body: The US imposed sanctions on Mumbai-based petrochemical trading company Tibalaji Petrochem Private Limited on Friday for carrying out oil trade with Iran. This marks the first time that such an action has been taken against an Indian company. Tibalaji purchased "millions of dollars' worth of" petrochemical products from Iran for "onward shipment to China", the US Department of Treasury said.

131.title: India reports 3,805 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 38,293
131.article_body: India reported 3,805 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 3,947 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in the country now stand at 38,293 following 5,069 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.29%.

132.title: I'm still friends with my exes, have very good relationship with them: Rashmika
132.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said that she is still friends with her exes. "I sort of like meet their families, their present, current, future, past, everything...But I have a very good relationship with them. So that's good," she added. She also reacted to rumours about her dating actor Vijay Deverakonda and called them "cute".

133.title: Thane mechanic gets donor heart in 4 days, discharged after 2 months
133.article_body: A Maharashtra state transport mechanic from Thane got a heart in 4 days after he was put on transplant list. The 39-year-old had suffered a heart attack which had damaged 70% of his heart. Reports said that the family of a 57-year-old brain-dead woman had agreed to donate her heart to him. He was discharged from hospital on September 30.

134.title: We are taking Putin's nuclear threats very seriously: US
134.article_body: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said that the US is taking Russian President Vladimir Putin's nuclear threats "very seriously". The US is communicating directly with Russia about the issue, including about decisive responses Washington would take if Moscow went down "that dark road", he added. Putin has warned Russia will use nuclear weapons if its "territorial integrity" is threatened.

135.title: Driver killed after tree falls on auto amid heavy rains in Pune
135.article_body: A 60-year-old autorickshaw driver was killed on Friday after a tree fell on his vehicle amid heavy rains in Pune, police said. The incident, which occurred around 4.30 pm, took place while the deceased was driving the autorickshaw, an inspector said. The fire brigade personnel were able to clear the tree to make way for traffic after two hours.

136.title: 25.76 grams of mephedrone worth ₹3.86 lakh seized in Pune, 3 arrested
136.article_body: Pune Police on Thursday arrested three men in possession of 25.76 grams of the banned drug mephedrone worth ₹3.86 lakh. The officials acted on a tip-off and arrested the accused on Shankar Sheth Road. Police also seized a two-wheeler and cell phones from them. Notably, police on Tuesday arrested two men and seized over 16 kg of opium poppy husk.

137.title: Babar Azam equals Virat Kohli's world record for being fastest to score 3,000 T20I runs
137.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has equalled former Team India captain Virat Kohli's world record for being the fastest batter to score 3,000 runs in T20I cricket. Babar reached the 3,000-run mark during his knock of 87*(59) against England in the sixth T20I. The 27-year-old took 81 innings to reach the milestone. Kohli had also taken 81 innings.

138.title: Meat shops, slaughterhouses to be shut on Gandhi Jayanti in Hyderabad
138.article_body: All meat shops will remain closed in Hyderabad on October 2 on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti, the civic body has said. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has also ordered all sheep, goat and cow slaughterhouses to be shut that day. The 153rd birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi will be celebrated across the country on Sunday.

139.title: Gates congratulates 13-year-old bridge champion Anshul, says 'Amazed by his skill'
139.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates congratulated Anshul Bhatt, a 13-year-old from Mumbai, who became the youngest winner at the World Youth Bridge Championship in Italy last month. "I'm amazed by...Bhatt's concentration and skill...his ability to win at Bridge on the world stage," wrote Gates on LinkedIn. In a tweet, the world's fifth-richest person also referred to bridge as his "favourite pastime".

140.title: Man dies of heart attack after getting eviction notice in Ghaziabad
140.article_body: A man from Ghaziabad suffered a heart attack and died allegedly after the civic body's officials pasted an eviction notice on his house a few days ago. The notice stated that the house is dilapidated and occupants should vacate it immediately, Hindustan Times reported. A councillor said that the family is poor and he'll raise the issue before corporation officials.

141.title: India abstains from UNSC vote against Russia's 'illegal referenda' in Ukraine
141.article_body: India abstained on a draft resolution at the UN Security Council condemning Russia's "illegal referenda" and annexation of four Ukrainian territories. While 10 nations voted for the resolution, India, China, Gabon, and Brazil abstained. India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Ambassador Ruchira Kamboj, said, "We urge that all efforts are made...for...cessation of violence and hostilities."

142.title: 15 major projects stalled as Delhi govt yet to give permission: LG to CM
142.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena wrote to CM Arvind Kejriwal stating that fifteen major projects involving the felling of trees and translocation are stalled as the government is yet to give permission. "Such unwarranted delays...leading to a waste of public funds due to time and cost overruns of the projects for which accountability needs to be fixed," LG added.

143.title: Total ban on sale of meat on Gandhi Jayanti in Bengaluru: BBMP
143.article_body: There will be a total ban on sale of meat and slaughter of animals on October 2 on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti in Bengaluru, civic body BBMP has said. The 153rd birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi will be celebrated across the country that day. BBMP had previously announced a similar ban on Ganesh Chaturthi on August 31.

144.title: BMC to fix 21 worst-affected Mumbai roads in 3 months, ₹228.49 cr allocated
144.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has informed the Bombay high court (HC) that it will concretise 21 worst-affected roads in Mumbai in three months. ₹228.49 crore have been allocated for the work. ₹140.2 crore have been allocated to the western suburbs. Meanwhile, ₹47 crore has been allocated for the concretisation of the 7.2-kilometre stretch of Aarey Road.

145.title: Musk expected to unveil 1st prototype of Tesla's humanoid robot Optimus
145.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is expected to provide a new look at its humanoid robot, Optimus, at Tesla AI Day on Friday. Musk announced Tesla's plan for humanoid robots at AI Day in August 2021 and delayed this year's event to have its robot prototype working. Ahead of the event, Tesla unveiled the robot's hands in a tweet.

146.title: Ex-J'khand minister KN Tripathi files nomination for Cong Prez poll
146.article_body: Former Jharkhand minister KN Tripathi on Friday submitted his nomination papers for the Congress President election. Tripathi handed over the nomination papers to Madhusudan Mistry, Chairman of the Congress' Central Election Authority. Tripathi, a former MLA, has also served in the Indian Air Force. Shashi Tharoor and Mallikarjun Kharge have also filed their nomination papers for the election.

147.title: Gas leaks from ONGC well in Guj; people complain of eye, throat irritation
147.article_body: Several people in Kasalpura village have complained of burning sensation in their eyes and throat after gas leaked from a well of the Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) in Gujarat's Mahesana on Friday, the District Development Officer said. "Compressed air that is pumped into the well has been escaping, and the gas is not poisonous or inflammable," he added.

148.title: 15 diamonds worth ₹1 crore mined in Panna in 2 days
148.article_body: As many as 15 diamonds were mined by people in the last two days in the shallow mines of Panna in Bundelkhand region of Madhya Pradesh. The stones collectively weigh a total of 35.86 carat and will fetch around ₹1 crore during the official auction, an official said. A man named Dukman Ahirwar found six diamonds out of the 15.

149.title: Three-person panel to look into Carlsen-Niemann cheating scandal
149.article_body: The International Chess Federation (FIDE) said a three-person panel will look into world champion Magnus Carlsen's allegations that American player Hans Niemann cheated during their match. "The panel will ensure a fair ruling, protecting the rights of both parties," said the federation. Carlsen had withdrawn from the Sinquefield Cup earlier this month after losing to 19-year-old Niemann.

150.title: Red Bull, Aston Martin exceeded 2021 F1 budget cap angering Ferrari: Report
150.article_body: Red Bull and Aston Martin are two F1 teams that have reportedly exceeded the 2021 budget cap. The report says violations up to $5 million are a 'minor rule violation' and the perpetrators "may get away with a fine". Ferrari is reportedly angry as the extra money "can be worth up to half a second on the race track".

151.title: Unseeded Indian pair Rohan-Sikki enter Vietnam Open mixed doubles semis
151.article_body: Indian mixed doubles pair of Rohan Kapoor and Sikki Reddy entered the semi-final at the Vietnam Open Super 100 tournament on Friday. The unseeded Indian duo beat third seeds Chan Peng Soon and Cheah Yee See of Malaysia 21-19, 21-17 in the quarter-final. They will face top seeds Rehan Naufal Kusharjanto and Lisa Ayu Kusumawati of Indonesia in the semi-final.

152.title: Happy on winning gold medal at 36th National Games: Weightlifter Mirabai
152.article_body: After winning a gold medal at 36th National Games in Gujarat, Olympic silver medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu tweeted, "Happy on winning [the] gold medal." Mirabai, representing Manipur, won the gold with a total lift of 191 kg. She lifted 84 kg in snatch event and 107 kg in the clean and jerk event in the women's 49-kg category on Friday.

153.title: Ind team to fly to Aus ahead of T20 WC to attend special preparation camp
153.article_body: The Indian cricket team is reportedly expected to fly to Australia ahead of the ICC T20 World Cup to attend a special preparation camp. According to ESPNcricinfo, the team will go on October 6, two days after the T20I series against South Africa gets over. India is likely to train at the camp till October 13.

154.title: Chile, Peru approach CAS to bar Ecuador from 2022 FIFA World Cup
154.article_body: Chile and Peru have both appealed to the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) to bar Ecuador from the 2022 FIFA World Cup. In September, FIFA had ruled for Ecuador in a dispute over defender Byron Castillo's nationality. Chile said there is "countless proof" that Castillo was born in Colombia in July 1995 and not in Ecuador in November 1998.

155.title: Have to coach and back him; I believe in him: Man Utd's Ten Hag on Maguire
155.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag said he's "really convinced" club captain Harry Maguire will improve his form. "I have to coach him and back him. I back him because I believe in him," said Ten Hag. Adding that the player was "really good" in pre-season, Ten Hag attributed Maguire being dropped to the "good performance" of the other centre-backs.

156.title: Nitish doesn't want to be PM, opp'n unity his only agenda: Tejashwi
156.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said CM Nitish Kumar's "only agenda...right now is bringing all opposition together". "Nitish Kumar is the Chief Minister and we are working under his guidance...He has no desire to become the PM," added Tejashwi. Kumar has been making appearances with other opposition leaders to possibly create a united front for the 2024 Lok Sabha Elections.

157.title: BJP-JJP govt in Haryana pushing youth into unemployment: Cong's Hooda
157.article_body: Congress' Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Friday alleged that the BJP-JJP government in Haryana is pushing the youth into the quagmire of unemployment. Expressing concern over the "appalling unemployment" in the state, Hooda said, "On one hand, Haryana is facing an unemployment rate of 37.3%, the highest in the country, and on the other, 1.82 lakh posts are...vacant in government departments."

158.title: Clear obstructions in front of Vizhinjam Port: HC to Kerala govt
158.article_body: The Kerala High Court (HC) asked the state government on Friday to clear obstructions put up by protesters in front of the Vizhinjam Port, which is being built by Adani Ports. The coastal people are demanding an impact study be done on the multi-crore project. Adani Ports had moved the court on August 25, seeking protection from the protesters.

159.title: Court not a place for publicity: SC on rejecting plea against EVMs
159.article_body: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea which claimed electronic voting machines (EVMs) were "controlled" by companies and not the Election Commission. "It (the court) is not a place where everybody walks in just to get some publicity," said the bench. The SC also stated that the petitioner, Madhya Pradesh Jan Vikas Party, is seeking "to get recognition by filing petitions".

160.title: 18-yr-old woman going for garba chased, molested by man in Gujarat
160.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly chased and molested an 18-year-old woman in Gujarat's Gandhinagar when she was going to a garba venue on Tuesday night. She claimed the man tore her clothes in a bid to rape her. The venue was reportedly located near her house. The accused escaped from the scene after the woman's brother arrived upon hearing her scream.

161.title: Mother-daughter duo killed in road accident in UP
161.article_body: A mother-daughter duo was killed after the motorcycle on which they were travelling was hit by a truck from behind on a national highway in Fatehpur, UP. The deceased, Pooja (25) and her daughter Anshika (3), were being taken by Pooja's brother, Santosh Kumar, to the former's in-laws' place, police said. Notably, the accused truck driver is absconding.

162.title: 7 arrested for killing Odisha tribal man on suspicion of sorcery
162.article_body: Seven people have been arrested in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district on Friday for allegedly killing a 33-year-old tribal man on suspicion of him practising black magic, an officer said. Pandu Munda, the 33-year-old deceased, belonged to Kothabila village. Munda's wife had told the police on Pandu being missing since September 17.

163.title: Zakir Naik's staffer acquitted of radicalisation charges
163.article_body: A special NIA court acquitted Arshi Qureshi, a manager of the Islamic Research Foundation, whose President Zakir Naik was arrested in 2016 on charges of radicalising youngsters. The acquittal came due to a lack of cogent evidence. A 4,000-page chargesheet was filed against Qureshi. He was arrested, along with two others, for allegedly radicalising 22 Muslim youths to join ISIS.

164.title: UP couple die by suicide after harassment despite paying back lenders
164.article_body: A couple in UP's Shahjahanpur died by suicide after allegedly being harassed by money lenders. A suicide note alleges that although the couple paid back their two loans of ₹1 lakh and ₹1.5 lakh with interest, the lenders were pressuring them to take more loans. Police said prima facie it appears the man strangulated his wife and then hanged himself.

165.title: Govt approves release of ₹488 cr disaster fund to UP, Punjab & Goa
165.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday approved the release of ₹488 crore to Uttar Pradesh, Punjab and Goa under the State Disaster Mitigation Fund (SDMF) for the year 2021-22. The money is to be used for undertaking mitigation activities to reduce the risks from disasters. The Centre has allocated ₹32,031 crore for the SDMF for the years 2021-22 to 2025-26.

166.title: Gunfire, explosions heard near Presidential Palace in Burkina Faso
166.article_body: Heavy gunfire and a large explosion were heard near the Presidential Palace and the military junta's headquarters in Ouagadougou, the capital of Burkina Faso, on Friday, giving rise to speculation of a mutiny. Troops were deployed on the major road junctions in the city. Military leader Paul-Henri Damiba has accused some army units of creating a "confused situation".

167.title: Great deal of history will be written in the Indo-Pacific: Biden
167.article_body: US President Joe Biden said, "a great deal" of the world's history will be written in the Indo-Pacific in the coming decades. Biden made the comments as he addressed leaders of over a dozen Pacific Island nations in Washington on Thursday. "The security of America...depends on your security and the security of the Pacific," Biden told the visiting leaders.

168.title: Sri Lanka recorded 69.8% inflation in September 2022
168.article_body: Sri Lanka’s inflation hit a record high of 69.8% in September this year, the Colombo Consumer Price Index said on Friday. In August, the country recorded inflation of 64.3%. Sri Lanka is presently experiencing an extreme economic crisis, which has resulted in an acute shortage of essential items like food and medicines.

169.title: Pak PM's House 'debugged': Officials after last week’s audio leaks
169.article_body: A top Pakistani panel has completed combing and debugging the Prime Minister's House in the Islamabad Capital Territory on Friday, officials said. Purported audio clips of Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif speaking with Principal Secretary Tauqeer Shah surfaced online last week. Earlier this week, former Prime Minister Imran Khan's audio clips were also leaked online.

170.title: India-made loitering munition successfully tested in Pokhran: Report
170.article_body: An indigenous loitering munition developed by Tata Advanced Systems Limited successfully struck its targets during tests at Pokhran, said a report. The system, called ALS 50, is designed for Vertical Take Off and Landing (VTOL) and will reportedly soon be inducted into the armed forces. The bomb-carrying drone reportedly has a range of 1,000 km and a 23-kg load-carrying capacity.

171.title: John Cena sets Guinness record for most wishes granted through Make-A-Wish Foundation
171.article_body: WWE star John Cena has entered the Guinness Book of World Records for granting the most wishes through the Make-A-Wish Foundation. Cena has granted 650 wishes so far, while no other personality has granted more than 200 wishes. Make-A-Wish Foundation is a non-profit organisation through which children with a critical illness can have one of their feasible wishes fulfilled.

172.title: WADA refuses to remove marijuana from list of banned substances
172.article_body: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) kept marijuana on its list of banned substances as the body rejected calls for change. World Athletics chief Sebastian Coe was among those who supported changing the status following sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson missing the Olympics after testing positive. WADA said removing marijuana from the list was "not supported by the experts' thorough review".

173.title: Bihar nursing home allegedly removes both kidneys of a woman
173.article_body: The Bihar Police has formed three special teams to nab the doctor and owner of a private nursing home for allegedly removing both the kidneys of a woman. The incident reportedly took place when the victim underwent a uterus-removal surgery. Doctors of a state-run hospital said more tests were needed to confirm if both her kidneys have been removed.

174.title: Indian-origin UK minister Braverman wins 1st Queen Elizabeth II award
174.article_body: UK's Indian-origin Home Secretary Suella Braverman has become the first-ever recipient of the Queen Elizabeth II Woman of the Year award. The 42-year-old Cabinet member said the award was the "honour of her life". "My mum and dad came to this country from Kenya and Mauritius in the 1960s," she said in a pre-recorded message for the award ceremony.

175.title: As a team, we are not going to analyse too much: Rohit on Bumrah
175.article_body: Indian skipper Rohit Sharma commented after pacer Jasprit Bumrah returned from an injury to the playing XI after a gap of over two months. "The back injury can be tricky.
