I am not going to talk too much about how he bowled...We are not going to analyse too much. Just want him to come and enjoy," Rohit said.

176.title: '21 TMC MLAs are in touch with me,' Mithun Chakraborty reiterates
176.article_body: West Bengal BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty on Saturday reiterated that 21 Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLAs are directly in touch with him. The actor-turned-politician said he is well aware of objections within BJP to inducting TMC leaders. "Many leaders have said that [BJP] won't take rotten potatoes," he added. TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh said, "TMC MLAs aren't up for sale."

177.title: Delhi records 71 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 0.81%
177.article_body: Delhi on Saturday reported 71 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 0.81%, as per the city health department. No deaths were recorded due to the infection in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 403, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi had recorded 95 cases of the viral disease on Friday.

178.title: Egypt to bid for hosting 2036 Olympic Games: Sports Minister
178.article_body: Egyptian Sports Minister Ashraf Sobhi said that the country will apply to host the Summer Olympic Games in 2036. A statement, issued by the Egyptian cabinet, quoted IOC President Thomas Bach as saying Egypt's sports infrastructure was capable of hosting the event. Notably, if the bid turns successful then Egypt will become the first African nation to host the event.

179.title: Digvijaya Singh gets bail in defamation case over comment on RSS
179.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Saturday was granted bail in a defamation case over his claim that people associated with Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) were receiving money from Pakistani spy agency Inter-Services Intelligence. He was granted bail on a personal bond of ₹50,000. Following the bail, Singh said that as RSS wasn't a registered organisation, it couldn't be defamed.

180.title: Death toll from migrant boat capsize off Syria reaches 94
180.article_body: The death toll from a migrant boat capsize earlier this week off the Syrian coast has climbed to 94, the Syrian state media said on Saturday. The rise in death toll comes as more bodies were recovered by Syrian authorities in an operation that began on Thursday afternoon, state media reported. The migrant boat had reportedly set sail from Lebanon.

181.title: I was not copybook style: MS Dhoni on his wicketkeeping style
181.article_body: Talking about his wicketkeeping style, former India captain MS Dhoni said that he was not copybook style. Talking about Kiran More helping him out initially, Dhoni added, "He helped me a lot with my keeping, with my drills. What I really liked was, he understood my wicketkeeping technique was unique."

182.title: Japan to welcome back foreign tourists from October 11
182.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida has said his country will welcome back tourists from October 11 this year, after an over two-year-long coronavirus-forced travel suspension. "Finally, Japan will reopen the border...visa waiver is back, no daily limit and free individual visits," Japanese Digital Minister Taro Kono tweeted. Japan suspended its visa programme in March 2020 after the COVID-19 outbreak.

183.title: India create history in Jhulan's last match, whitewash England in ODIs at their home
183.article_body: India created history on Saturday by completing a women's ODI series whitewash against England on England soil for the first time ever. India defeated England by 16 runs in the third ODI. India were bowled out for 169 runs, while England were dismissed for 153 runs. Jhulan Goswami, who was featuring in her last international match, took two wickets.

184.title: Hope to make hockey World Cup debut in Odisha next year: Abhishek
184.article_body: Indian men's hockey team forward Abhishek, who was part of India's silver medal-winning team at Commonwealth Games 2022, said he hopes he can make his World Cup debut in Odisha in January next year. "And I hope to make it a pleasant memory as well. It'll be a lot of fun in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela at...World Cup 2023," he added.

185.title: 730 detained in anti-mobilisation protests across Russia: Rights group
185.article_body: At least 730 people were detained across Russia on Saturday at protests against Kremlin's military mobilisation order, a rights group cited by Reuters said. The OVD-Info protest monitoring group said it was aware of detentions in 32 different cities. Earlier this week, President Vladimir Putin ordered Russia's first military draft since World War 2 for the conflict in Ukraine.

186.title: 2021 US Open champion Raducanu retires from semi-final in Korea
186.article_body: World number 77 Emma Raducanu was forced to retire from the Hana Bank Korea Open semi-final against Jelena Ostapenko on Saturday due to a left glute injury. The 19-year-old, who was playing in her first semi-final since winning US Open last year, was down 4-6, 6-3, 3-0 when she retired. Top seed Ostapenko will face Ekaterina Alexandrova in Sunday's final.

187.title: Cong in Karnataka is united, BJP engaged in propaganda war: Khader
187.article_body: Congress MLA UT Khader said that the Karnataka unit of the party is united and the ruling BJP is engaged in a propaganda war. Senior state Congress leaders, DK Shivakumar and Siddaramaiah, are having a cordial relationship, Khader said. He added that the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is aimed at building bonds of friendship among the people of all states.

188.title: Half of judiciary's issues are state-sponsored litigations: Ex-CJI
188.article_body: Former CJI NV Ramana said half of the judiciary's problems would be resolved if the government puts a halt to state-sponsored litigations. "Inter-departmental disputes, service matters and those relating to the inaction of authorities clogging the system are appalling," said Ramana. He added that the judicial infrastructure in the country even after 75 years of independence was 'disturbing'.

189.title: I was about to vomit: Falguni on remixed version of her song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai'
189.article_body: Talking about her first reaction to the remixed version of her song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai' sung by Neha Kakkar, Falguni Pathak said, "I was about to vomit." She added, "The video and picturization had such innocence but they have ruined it." She further said, "If you want to reach out to...younger generation, change...rhythm of...song, but don’t make it cheap."

190.title: Woman gets her husband married to his ex-lover in Andhra, trio to live together
190.article_body: A woman in Andhra Pradesh officiated the wedding of her husband with his former partner in a traditional ceremony at a temple in Tirupati. Kalyan, who was married to Vimala, came in contact with his ex Nitya Sree recently and Kalyan and Nitya convinced Vimala to agree to their marriage. The trio will reportedly live together in the same house.

191.title: Jhulan gets guard of honour by England players in last match of her career, video viral
191.article_body: India pacer Jhulan Goswami got a guard of honour by England players while coming out to bat in last match of her career. England Cricket tweeted, "For over 20 years Jhulan has run in...hit a length and blazed a trail...She has bowled nearly 10,000 balls in ODIs...and she may just have inspired as many young girls to try cricket."

192.title: Won't ever comment on Verstappen's driving or personality: Hamilton
192.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton refused to speak about current world champion Max Verstappen's personality and driving. "I won't ever comment on either of those," said Hamilton when asked during a video wherein other F1 drivers spoke highly of Verstappen. Recently, Red Bull team principal Christian Horner accused Hamilton of "never once" recognising "Max's ability".

193.title: 3, including 2 Iranian tourists, injured in road accident in UP
193.article_body: Three persons, including two Iranian tourists, were injured when the mini-bus they were travelling in rammed into a vehicle ahead of it on Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, police said. The injured were identified as 35-year-old Aafia and 30-year-old Ilhan. There were 17 foreign tourists who were going to Agra to visit the Taj Mahal and other monuments.

194.title: Activists stage protest against Kerala dog killings at Delhi's Jantar Mantar
194.article_body: Animal rights activists, including several children and youths, staged a peaceful protest at Delhi's Jantar Mantar on Saturday against killing of street dogs in Kerala. They alleged that despite Supreme Court's orders to protect dogs, they are being killed mercilessly. Several cases of dogs being poisoned, beaten, and burned alive amid rising dog bite incidents in Kerala have come up.

195.title: Bids invited for bullet train project tunnel passing under sea
195.article_body: The National High Speed Rail Corporation has invited bids for constructing a 21-km underground tunnel as part of the Ahmedabad-Mumbai bullet train project. A 7-km stretch of the tunnel will be constructed under the sea, making it a complex engineering work. This is the third time bids are being invited for the project after failed attempts in 2019 and 2021.

196.title: Video of 'Shaka Laka...' actor shooting with magic pencil surfaces, fans react
196.article_body: A video of 'Shaka Laka Boom Boom' actor Kinshuk Vaidya filming with the 'magic pencil' from the show has surfaced online. In the video, shared by photographer Viral Bhayani, Kinshuk could be seen trying to bring something to life with the pencil. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Childhood memories," while another commented, "Ohh my god...is it coming again??"

197.title: Power gone into heads of BJP leaders: AAP MLA on Ankita murder case
197.article_body: AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj has called the murder of 19-year-old Ankita Bhandari an extremely shameful act. BJP leader Vinod Arya's son has been arrested in the case. Bharadwaj claimed the murder was the result of power going into BJP leaders' heads. "BJP is so intoxicated in power that even a small [BJP] leader...believes that he rules the country," he added.

198.title: India & other Quad nations commit to expanding UN Security Council
198.article_body: The Quadrilateral Security Dialogue or Quad has committed to expanding the permanent and non-permanent seats of the UN Security Council (UNSC). In a joint statement, the Foreign Ministers of India, Japan, Australia and the US said reforming the world body would help reflect the "current global realities". Earlier, US President Joe Biden said the UNSC should be reformed.

199.title: KRK says he will quit reviewing films after 'Vikram Vedha'
199.article_body: Actor and film critic Kamaal Rashid Khan aka KRK tweeted on Saturday that he'll not be reviewing films after 'Vikram Vedha'. "Thanks to all...Bollywood people...for not accepting me as...critic but filing so many cases against me to stop my reviews," he added. KRK was arrested over derogatory tweet and molestation cases on August 30. He was later released on bail.

200.title: Indian football team held to 1-1 draw by lower ranked Singapore
200.article_body: Indian men's football team played out a 1-1 draw with Singapore at the Hung Thinh Friendly Football Tournament in Vietnam. Singapore, the 159th ranked team, opened the scoring in the 37th minute as India hit back with an Ashique Kuruniyan equaliser six minutes later. "There are many things that we could have done better," said Sunil Chhetri after the match.

201.title: Indian partition was irrational, done in hurry: Ram Madhav
201.article_body: RSS leader Ram Madhav said that the partition of India, which led to the creation of Pakistan, was irrational and was done in a hurry. "Mahatma Gandhi may not be fully absolved of the sequence of events ending in the tragic partition...but it will be unfair to blame one man who represented many lofty ideals and inspired generations," Madhav said.

202.title: Piyush Goyal discusses bilateral ties with Singaporean minister
202.article_body: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal met Tharman Shanmugaratnam, Singapore Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies, during his visit to the island nation on Saturday. "Discussed strengthening bilateral cooperation across several areas of mutual interest," Goyal tweeted. Later, Goyal held a roundtable with business executives and investors.

203.title: One more arrested in Amritsar IED case for arranging motorcycle
203.article_body: One more person was arrested for his alleged involvement in planting an IED under the car of a Punjab Police sub-inspector in Amritsar, police said on Saturday. The arrested man has been identified as Satnam Singh alias Honey. He is suspected of providing a motorcycle to the accused person who was arrested earlier for planting the explosive device, police added.

204.title: Kejriwal, Mann to visit Ahmedabad tomorrow ahead of Gujarat polls
204.article_body: Senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders Arvind Kejriwal and Bhagwant Mann will visit Ahmedabad on Sunday in preparation for the Gujarat elections. “Will interact with youth, safai karamcharis and temporary employees there. Every section of Gujarat considers the Aam Aadmi Party as their hope,” Kejriwal tweeted. Ahead of the assembly polls, Kejriwal has been travelling to the state every week.

205.title: Iran planning 'proportional' response to Ukraine downgrading ties
205.article_body: Iran is planning a "proportional" response to Ukraine downgrading ties with the country over "unconfirmed reports" of drone sales to Russia, Tehran said on Saturday. Kyiv on Friday said that it would revoke the Iranian ambassador's accreditation over Tehran's decision to supply Russian forces with drones. The staff strength at the Iranian embassy would also be significantly downsized, Kyiv added.

206.title: Pant is a predetermined, premeditated cricketer: Gavaskar
206.article_body: Former Indian skipper Sunil Gavaskar said that wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant needs to develop his "off-side game". "Pant is a predetermined, premeditated cricketer. He decides quite often what he is going to do before the ball is bowled," Gavaskar said. "That's why he gets into trouble as he looks for something which is not there," the 73-year-old former cricketer added.

207.title: BJP appoints Shiv Bakshi as Parliamentary Party Office Secretary
207.article_body: The BJP has appointed Shiv Shakti Nath Bakshi as the party's new Parliamentary Party Office Secretary. BJP General Secretary and Headquarters In-charge Arun Singh passed an order with regard to the appointment. Bakshi is the current National Convenor of the BJP Journals and Publication Department. He is also the Executive Editor of BJP's mouthpiece Kamal Sandesh.

208.title: Divisive & communal organisations should be banned: Maha Cong Prez
208.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole on Saturday demanded a ban on Popular Front of India (PFI), which is under the scanner for allegedly supporting terror activities. "Divisive and communal organisations should be banned. The Congress wants peace and such tendencies to create a divide should be stopped," he said. Patole criticised the alleged raising of 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans in Pune.

209.title: School principal shot at by Class 12 student in UP; critical
209.article_body: A Class 12 student of Adarsh Ramswaroop Inter College in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district allegedly shot at the school's principal on the campus on Saturday. The 48-year-old principal, who was shot twice in the stomach, is stated to be in a critical condition. Police said the shooting came a day after the victim scolded two Class 12 students for fighting.

210.title: They're trying to make me a prostitute: U'khand resort receptionist texted friend
210.article_body: Uttarakhand resort receptionist Ankita Bhandari had sent her friend a text message, before her death, saying, "They are trying to turn me into a prostitute." Bhandari was working at a resort owned by ex-BJP leader Vinod Arya's son Pulkit, who's been accused of murdering her. She reportedly alleged she was being forced to provide "special services" to guests for ₹10,000.

211.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till September 27, list released
211.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued a heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs till September 27. Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura may witness heavy rainfall across the next three days. Odisha may witness heavy rainfall on September 27. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is expected over Himachal Pradesh, Bihar, Uttarakhand, West Bengal and Sikkim on September 25.

212.title: Will present world-class VFX in 'Krrish 4': Rakesh Roshan
212.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said to compete with Hollywood, he has no choice but to present world-class VFX in 'Krrish 4'. "They've been using VFX for so many years. So their way of working, understanding is faster and so is their visualisation," he said. He also promised to treat the audience with a lot of special effects in 'Krrish 4'.

213.title: We're trying to be a bit more aggressive upfront: Aaron Finch
213.article_body: After losing the second T20I to India on Friday, Australian captain Aaron Finch said that their side is trying to play with an aggressive approach. "It's important that you're always looking at ways to improve and obviously, we went with [Glenn] Maxwell at three, Tim David at four, so we're trying to be a bit more aggressive upfront," Finch said.

214.title: Arsenal have good chance to win Premier League this season: Ex-manager Wenger
214.article_body: Former manager Arsene Wenger has said Arsenal have a "good chance" to win the Premier League title this season in the absence of a "super dominating" team. With 18 points from opening seven matches of the season, Arsenal are currently on top of the standings. Both defending champions Manchester City and Tottenham Hotspur are one point behind Arsenal.

215.title: 2 labourers from Bihar injured after terrorists open fire in J&K's Pulwama
215.article_body: Two labourers from Bihar suffered injuries after terrorists opened fire on them in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Saturday evening. Police said the labourers have been shifted to a hospital, where their condition is stated to be stable. As per reports, the incident took place in the Ratnipora area of Pulwama.

216.title: Broad reacts to pic of Federer, Nadal crying, says 'Me, when Jimmy retires in 2053'
216.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad took to his Instagram Stories to react to the picture of Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal crying after Federer's last-ever professional match. "Me, when Jimmy (James Anderson) retires in 2053," he wrote. Federer played his last tennis match by teaming up with Rafael Nadal for a doubles match in Laver Cup.

217.title: J’khand CM’s aide ran illegal mining operation worth ₹1,000 cr: ED
217.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has told the PMLA Court in Ranchi that CM Hemant Soren’s MLA representative Pankaj Mishra was managing an illegal mining operation worth over ₹1,000 crore in Jharkhand’s Sahibganj district and adjacent areas. The ED has named Mishra and his associates Bacchu Yadav and Prem Prakash as accused. All the accused are in judicial custody.

218.title: CBI arrests ex-Mumbai Police chief in NSE phone tapping case
218.article_body: The CBI on Saturday arrested former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey after a Delhi court granted a four-day remand of Pandey to the probe agency in connection with the National Stock Exchange (NSE) phone tapping case. It is alleged that Pandey's company iSec Services Private Limited, along with others, illegally intercepted and recorded calls by various NSE officials from 2009-2017.

219.title: Axar Patel can bowl in any stage, gives advantage: Rohit Sharma
219.article_body: After Indian spinner Axar Patel picked up two wickets against Australia in the 2nd T20I on Friday, skipper Rohit Sharma spoke about the importance of the 28-year-old bowler in the team. "Axar can bowl in any stage, which gives me an advantage of using the other bowlers in different situations too...maybe use the pacers in the middle overs," Rohit said.

220.title: Harmeet Desai wins men's singles TT title at National Games
220.article_body: Table tennis player Harmeet Desai beat Soumyajit Ghosh 11-8, 11-4, 11-7, 11-8 to win men's singles title at 36th National Games in Surat on Saturday. "My goal is to be...top-ranked Indian player while also entering the top-50 of world rankings," said Desai. The 29-year-old is currently ranked 124th in the world, while Sathiyan Gnanasekaran is the top-ranked Indian at 37.

221.title: Premeditated: CM on violence during PFI's hartal in Kerala
221.article_body: Kerala witnessed premeditated violence during the hartal led by the Popular Front of India (PFI) on Friday, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said on Saturday. Stating that it was an attempt to destroy the peaceful atmosphere of the state, Vijayan added that the culprits will not be spared. He noted that the violence resulted in destruction of public and private properties.

222.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Gorkha' to go on floors in 2023: Reports
222.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Gorkha' will reportedly go on the floors next year. According to reports, the scripting of the film is likely to be completed by March 2023. The makers are trying to make the film "as authentic as possible", reports said. 'Gorkha', based on the life of Major General Ian Cardozo, will be directed by Sanjay Puran Singh Chauhan.

223.title: Will target those chanting 'Pak Zindabad' during Pune PFI stir: Rane
223.article_body: Maharashtra BJP MLA Nitesh Rane promised action over reports of 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans being raised during protests supporting PFI in Pune and said 'each will be targeted'. "To all those shouting Pakistan Zindabad slogans in support of PFI in Pune...Chun chun ke marenge...Itna yaad rakhna!!! (We will catch and strike each one of you...remember this)," tweeted Rane.

224.title: India's 1st radar to detect avalanche in 3 seconds installed in Sikkim
224.article_body: The Indian Army and Defence Geoinformatics Research Establishment (DGRE) have jointly installed an Avalanche Monitoring Radar in north Sikkim. The radar is the first of its kind in India and can detect avalanches within three seconds of their trigger. It uses a series of short microwave pulses scattered at the target to detect the avalanche.

225.title: Kartik is a director's actor, his intensity in 'Freddy' shocked me: Director
225.article_body: 'Freddy' director Shashanka Ghosh called Kartik Aaryan a director's actor and said, "His intensity in the film shocked me." "Off-screen, he comes across as a handsome and easy-going guy. But when the camera rolls, he is immersed in his role," he added. "Kartik told me that he is losing sleep because of what he was playing in 'Freddy'," said Shashanka.

226.title: Opposition leaders 'chronic liars': Punjab CM Mann
226.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday criticised Opposition leaders, calling them "chronic liars" and also accused them of being habitual of finding faults in every pro-people initiative of his government. Speaking at Faridkot, he said due to a dearth of any concrete issues, these leaders are criticising the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government only for the sake of criticism.

227.title: Punjab will get its first sign language centre in Patiala: Minister
227.article_body: Punjab Health and Family Welfare Minister Chetan Singh Jouramajra on Saturday announced that Punjab government will open the state's first centre for teaching sign language at Patiala. Attending a function organised by Patiala Association of Deaf, he said the Punjab government is not only providing special job opportunities to such people, but also taking steps to empower all the disabled.

228.title: Samruddhi Expressway will change the face of Vidarbha: Fadnavis
228.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said the Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway will change the face of Vidarbha. "It will become the next economic corridor of the country," Fadnavis said. He said there were plans to develop connectivity between Nagpur and Goa on the lines of the Samruddhi Expressway that links Vidarbha's largest city with Mumbai.

229.title: Pic shows Sule sitting on CM's chair; NCP says 'morphed', files complaint
229.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Saturday accused the spokesperson of the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction of sharing a "morphed" picture of Baramati MP Supriya Sule sitting in the CM's chair. The NCP has filed a complaint with police and demanded appropriate action against the concerned Twitter handle used for posting Sule's picture and the person who posted it.

230.title: Damn you Roger, will be walking with swollen eyes for whole weekend: Kim
230.article_body: Four-time Grand Slam champion Kim Clijsters took to Twitter after Roger Federer played the last match of his career and wrote, "Damn you Roger...will be walking around with swollen eyes for the whole weekend." Federer played a doubles match alongside Rafael Nadal for Team Europe at Laver Cup. "What an emotional night! One and only Roger Federer!" tweeted Caroline Wozniacki.

231.title: Police officer attacked by cannabis smugglers; critically injured
231.article_body: A Karnataka Police inspector was attacked by a mob of over 30 smugglers after the official and his team recovered a consignment of cannabis, a senior police officer said on Saturday. Inspector Srimant Illal sustained grievous injuries in the attack that took place on the Karnataka-Maharashtra border, police said. He is reportedly undergoing treatment and is in critical condition.

232.title: Female student filmed by her batchmates while changing clothes in MP, blackmailed
232.article_body: Three male students of Bhopal's Industrial Training Institute (ITI) allegedly recorded a video of one of their female batchmates, while she was changing clothes, police said. They later showed the clip to her friend and allegedly demanded around ₹5,000 to not leak it on social media, police said. One of the accused students' was arrested.

233.title: 32-yr-old ASHA worker from Kashmir donates blood 28 times since 2012
233.article_body: A 32-year-old Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) from Kashmir has donated blood 28 times since 2012, reports said. Bilqees Ara, who is known as 'blood woman of Kashmir', said she's proud to be the saviour of patients. "I've donated blood to...accident victims, pregnant ladies and other patients in almost every hospital in North Kashmir," the mother of three children added.

234.title: Army man who blackmailed Chandigarh University student to leak videos arrested
234.article_body: An Army personnel, who allegedly blackmailed a Chandigarh University female student to leak objectionable videos of other female students, was arrested on Saturday. The accused, identified as Sanjeev Singh, was arrested from Sela Pass, Arunachal Pradesh, officials said. So far four people, including the female student, have been arrested in connection to the leak of the videos.

235.title: India's 18-year-old Grandmaster Nihal Sarin defeats former world chess champion Kramnik
235.article_body: India's 18-year-old Grandmaster Nihal Sarin defeated ex-world chess champion Vladimir Kramnik in round of 32 of the 2022 Chess.com Global Championship. Nihal won the match with a margin of 2.5-0.5. Nihal will now face world number two Ding Liren in the round of 16. Meanwhile, India's 16-year-old Grandmaster Raunak Sadhwani crashed out of the tournament after losing to Anish Giri.

236.title: Don't worry, BJP will be wiped out: Lalu Yadav ahead of Delhi visit
236.article_body: RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav, ahead of his Delhi visit to meet Congress President Sonia Gandhi, claimed that the BJP would be "wiped out". Yadav's response came when he asked about Home Minister Amit Shah's rally in Bihar's Purnea. Lalu, after his meeting in Delhi, will also attend a rally in Haryana by former CM Om Prakash Chautala.

237.title: VHP protests outside UK Embassy over attacks on Indians in Britain
237.article_body: Members of Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Saturday gathered outside the UK Embassy in Delhi to protest against the attacks on Indians in Britain's Leicester, Birmingham and Smethwick. They were protesting in an effort to meet embassy officials. Earlier, VHP wrote a letter to UK PM Liz Truss saying that Hindus and their places of worship were targeted by extremists.

238.title: Congress won't retain Kerala LS seats it won in 2019: CM Vijayan
238.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said the Congress party will not be able to retain the Lok Sabha seats it won during the 2019 Parliamentary elections in the state. Vijayan said Congress MPs, including Rahul Gandhi, have failed to 'resist' the BJP at the national level. He added that people last time voted for Rahul thinking he would become the PM.

239.title: Rakhi Sawant is next: Hema Malini on Kangana reportedly fighting Mathura polls
239.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini responded to speculation that actor Kangana Ranaut may contest elections from her constituency in UP's Mathura and said, "Tomorrow, even Rakhi Sawant will [fight polls]." Malini further said, "So you won't even consider a local...You want only film stars in Mathura?" Ranaut earlier this week visited shrines in Vrindavan along with her family and offered prayers.

240.title: Woman dies due to power cut at hospital during C-section in Tamil Nadu
240.article_body: A 22-year-old woman reportedly died following a power outage during C-section at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Annur. According to police, the non-functioning of generator led to complications, forcing the doctors to shift her to a private hospital. She gave birth to a boy, who is fine, but after delivery, her condition deteriorated and she died.

241.title: 2 chefs of Guj girls' school held for sexually harassing students
241.article_body: Two chefs of a residential girls' school in Gujarat's Valsad district were arrested on Saturday for allegedly sexually harassing and verbally abusing tribal girl students. The principal and all seven chefs of the residential school have been transferred to other schools. The arrests came after the principal of the school lodged a complaint with the police against the accused.

242.title: Teaser of Varun's Bhediya to be shown before Vikram Vedha in cinemas: Reports
242.article_body: The teaser of Varun Dhawan and Kriti Sanon's 'Bhediya' will be shown before the shows of 'Vikram Vedha' in cinemas, according to reports. The Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan-starrer film will hit the screens on September 30. 'Bhediya', also starring Abhishek Banerjee and Deepak Dobriyal, is a horror-comedy film directed by Amar Kaushik.

243.title: Wrestler Bajrang Punia withdraws from National Games due to head injury
243.article_body: Olympic bronze medallist Bajrang Punia has withdrawn from upcoming 36th National Games due to a head injury sustained during the recently concluded World Wrestling Championships in Serbia. "It's unfortunate that it happened so close to the event. The cut is fresh...will take time to heal," said Bajrang. The 28-year-old won a bronze medal in men's 65-kg category at World Championships.

244.title: Our forest cover has increased, wetlands also expanding rapidly: PM
244.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated the National Conference of Environment Ministers in Gujarat's Ekta Nagar via video conferencing. He said that India is a rapidly developing economy, which is also continuously strengthening its ecology. "Today's new India is moving ahead with new thinking [and] new approach...Our forest cover has increased and wetlands are also expanding rapidly," he added.

245.title: Jammu's mayor and deputy mayor resign following BJP meet
245.article_body: The mayor and deputy mayor of the BJP-led Jammu Municipal Corporation (JMC) on Saturday resigned from their posts following a meeting with party corporators and leaders. Mayor Chander Mohan Gupta and his deputy Purnima Sharma stepped down voluntarily, J&K BJP President Ravinder Raina said. The party will choose the next mayor and their deputy after consulting its corporators, Raina said.

246.title: Great white shark draws 'self-portrait' with its path in the ocean, pic surfaces
246.article_body: A great white shark fitted with a GPS tracker appeared to draw a self-portrait with its path in the Atlantic Ocean, experts have said. The shark named Breton was fitted with a tracker in 2020 as part of a research programme in Nova Scotia. Its movements, spanning a total of 444 days, appeared to draw the outline of a shark.

247.title: Harmanpreet breaks down ahead of Jhulan Goswami's last international match, video viral
247.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur broke down ahead of fast bowler Jhulan Goswami's last international match on Saturday. A video has gone viral showing Harmanpreet getting emotional and hugging Jhulan as the team felicitated her ahead of the ODI against England at Lord's. Harmanpreet also honoured Jhulan by going for the toss with her.

248.title: Japan ex-PM Abe’s funeral to cost more than UK Queen's funeral: Reports
248.article_body: Former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe's state funeral will cost more than UK's Queen Elizabeth II's recent state funeral, reports have said. Abe's funeral expenses are estimated to go up to 1.66 billion yen (around ₹94 crore), as against the reported cost of the Queen's funeral of 1.3 billion yen (around ₹74 crore). People have protested the funeral's high cost.

249.title: Mom didn't want me to become actor after dad's death: Gulshan's daughter
249.article_body: Actress Khushali Kumar, daughter of late Gulshan Kumar, revealed that her mother got very scared after Gulshan's death. "She didn't want to put anyone of us before...camera...Mumma told us, 'No matter what you do, do it behind...camera.' Convincing her was a process," said Khushali, who was recently seen in Madhavan-starrer 'Dhokha'. Gulshan was shot dead in Mumbai in August 1997.

250.title: Stern action against those who raised 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans: Fadnavis
250.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said that stern action will be taken against those who raised 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans in Pune. "We will find them and take action against them," Fadnavis said. His comment comes after a video of protesters purportedly raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans during a Popular Front of India (PFI) protest in Pune surfaced online.

251.title: BJP, RSS nervous due to Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Jairam Ramesh
251.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Saturday claimed the BJP and RSS are nervous due to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which has forced the RSS chief to reach out to various sections of society. "This is the effect of our initiative," Ramesh said. Speaking about RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's visit to a mosque in Delhi, he said, "Bhagwat's visit was...a publicity stunt."

252.title: MP CM scolds official on stage over negligence, says 'you're suspended'
252.article_body: A government official was publicly scolded by Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan for failing to issue an adequate number of cards under the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana. The CM called the official on stage during a programme and asked him to explain what went wrong. "Go, you're suspended," Chouhan was purportedly heard saying, after speaking to the official.

253.title: Amit Shah to embark on a 3-day visit to J&K from Sept 30
253.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah will be on a three-day visit to Jammu and Kashmir from September 30, where he is scheduled to address two rallies and review developmental activities. However, Jammu and Kashmir BJP General Secretary Sunil Sharma said the visit should not be linked to Assembly elections. "It will be...[Shah's] direct dialogue with the people of Kashmir," Sharma said.

254.title: Bengaluru woman robbed of ₹2 lakh in cyber fraud; amount recovered later
254.article_body: After losing ₹2 lakh in online fraud, the victim, Veena Chaturvedi, got her lost amount back within 10 days after filing the complaint. Veena is the mother of Bengaluru-based comedian Jagdish Chaturvedi. "My mother had received a message from an HDFC look-alike number that said her net banking will be frozen if she doesn't verify her PAN immediately," Jagdish said.

255.title: When I hear Federer's name, I get nightmares: Ex world no. 1 Roddick
255.article_body: Paying tribute to 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer following his last career match at Laver Cup, ex-world number one Andy Roddick said, "When I hear the name of Roger, I get nightmares because he gave me nightmares for so long." Nick Kyrgios said, "He is the Michael Jordan of tennis. I think, without Roger, there's no GOAT to chase."

256.title: Argentina defeat Honduras by 3-0; Messi scores twice
256.article_body: Argentina defeated Honduras by 3-0 in a friendly game in Miami on Friday. Forward Lionel Messi scored two goals with one of them coming from a penalty strike. The match was part of the preparation for the two teams ahead of this year's FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Argentina will play their next friendly game against Jamaica on Tuesday.

257.title: 3 rare migratory birds sighted in Gurugram
257.article_body: Three migratory coastal birds, which are typically not seen in the National Capital Region, have been sighted in Gurugram's Chandu Budhera, said ornithophile Kavi Nanda. He sighted the bar-tailed godwit last week, the common ringed plover and red-necked phalarope this week. It is believed that rough weather changed the course of these birds who were flying in from Siberia.

258.title: ₹100-crore Jagannath Temple in WB's Digha to be complete by 2023
258.article_body: The ₹100-crore Jagannath Temple being built by the West Bengal government in Digha will be completed by December 2023, an official said on Saturday. The temple, resembling the centuries-old Jagannath Temple in Odisha's Puri, is being built on a 20-acre plot near the Old Digha beach. The 65-metre-high temple will have idols of Lord Jagannath, Lord Balabhadra and Goddess Subhadra.

259.title: Tender floated to procure 3,980 electric buses for Delhi
259.article_body: Convergence Energy Services Limited, a subsidiary under the Union Power Ministry, has floated a tender to procure 3,980 electric buses for Delhi. The tender was floated on September 21. Valued at around ₹5,000 crore, the tender aims to procure 5,690 electric buses. Other than Delhi, the remaining buses are for Haryana, Telangana, Arunachal Pradesh and Gujarat states.

260.title: Part of hill collapses in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh; 40 stranded
260.article_body: A massive landslide in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh blocked the Tawaghat-Lipulekh highway after part of a hill collapsed near Najang Tamba on Friday evening. At least 40 pilgrims, who undertook the Adi Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, along with local residents are reportedly stranded due to the closure of the highway. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far.

261.title: Aaron Finch's reaction after getting clean bowled on Jasprit Bumrah's yorker goes viral
261.article_body: A video of Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch's reaction after getting clean bowled on India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's yorker in the second T20I in Nagpur has gone viral. In the video, Finch can be seen applauding Bumrah for this delivery. Finch was dismissed for 31(15). India went on to win the match by six wickets.

262.title: What is CBI's 'Operation Megha Chakra' against child porn?
262.article_body: CBI has launched a nationwide operation code-named 'Operation Megha Chakra', aimed at cracking down on the circulation of child pornography and those circulating it. The name indicates the alleged offences of downloading and distributing Child Sexual Exploitation Material (CSEM) via 'Cloud Space'. Raids were carried out in Delhi, UP, Bihar, Punjab, Haryana, Maharashtra, Gujarat and other states.

263.title: Week-long 'Infinite Library' project begins in Pune
263.article_body: The Max Mueller Bhavan began showcasing on Saturday a week-long 'Infinite Library' project in Pune. The project aims to show libraries of the future using a virtual reality installation. Creative Director of 'Infinite Library' Mika Johnson said the project "will help to reimagine history and understand interrelations". The project can be viewed free of cost but pre-registration is mandatory.

264.title: Rafael Nadal pulls out of Laver Cup due to personal reasons
264.article_body: Rafael Nadal has pulled out of Laver Cup due to personal reasons. This comes after he teamed up with Roger Federer for a doubles match for Team Europe against Team World. "I'm not doing well. It's been a tough time for me, I hardly slept...I was stressful," Nadal said after the match, which was the last match of Federer's career.

265.title: I'm getting to fulfil my childhood dream in 'Code Name: Tiranga': Parineeti
265.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra, who'll play an agent in the upcoming film 'Code Name: Tiranga', said, "Growing up, I fantasised being an agent for my country." She added that she used to carry a toy gun and pretend she was the best agent in service of the country. "So, I'm getting to fulfil my childhood dream in [the film]," said Parineeti.

266.title: Tenders invited to build underground tunnel for Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor
266.article_body: Tenders have been invited to build a 7-km-long tunnel under the sea, a first of its kind in the country. This will be part of the 21-km-long tunnel, which will be built in Maharashtra for the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High-Speed Rail Corridor. The tunnel will be between the Bandra-Kurla Complex underground station and Shilphata in Maharashtra.

267.title: Man steals 30 motorcycles in B'luru to pay gambling debts, arrested
267.article_body: A professional photographer has been arrested for allegedly stealing around 30 motorcycles in Bengaluru and selling them in his hometown in Tumakuru to pay gambling debts. N Sridhar alias Chingari used to steal motorcycles parked on roadsides in residential localities whenever he faced a financial crisis, police said. He would reportedly wear a helmet to avoid being stopped by police.

268.title: Over 38,000 FYJC seats vacant after 5 rounds of admissions in Pune
268.article_body: After three regular and two special sessions of admissions for first-year junior college (FYJC), 38,255 seats remained vacant in the Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad regions. Assistant Director of Education, Pune, Meena Shendkar said students must be careful before cancelling their seats as there may be no more rounds for admission. Colleges will release the list of admitted students on September 25.

269.title: Mom & dad were very protective, we lived an insular life: Shweta Bachchan
269.article_body: Amitabh and Jaya Bachchan's daughter Shweta Bachchan has said she grew up in a protective environment. She also revealed that she and her brother Abhishek Bachchan were kept away from the glamour world during their growing-up years. "We...didn't understand much of what was going on out there...We never had magazines at home...TV in...80s was minimal...We lived...[an] insular life," Shweta added.

270.title: University of Hyderabad students protest against exam fees hike
270.article_body: University of Hyderabad (UoH) students on Friday protested against hike in examination fees and raised slogans outside the office of Controller of Examinations (CoE) on campus. Shiva Durga Rao, secretary of the Students Federation of India (SFI) on campus, said examination fees were hiked from ₹600 to ₹4,000. Rao said the security guards manhandled students when they were protesting peacefully.

271.title: Rohit was brilliant, Axar was the difference: Finch on 2nd T20I loss
271.article_body: Following Australia's six-wicket loss against India in second T20I, Australia captain Aaron Finch said India captain Rohit Sharma's "brilliant" knock of 20-ball 46* and two overs bowled by Axar Patel made the difference. Axar posted bowling figures of 2-0-13-2. Match was reduced to eight overs per side amid wet outfield. India chased down the 91-run target in 7.2 overs.

272.title: 77-yr-old yoga tutor jailed for sexually abusing 5-yr-old girl in B'luru
272.article_body: A 77-year-old yoga tutor has been sentenced to five years in prison for sexually assaulting a five-year-old student in Bengaluru. The incident took place in August 2018. The minor's mother had sent her to a guest room in the yoga centre to collect some books when the convict, who was alone inside, locked the door and sexually assaulted her.

273.title: 'Model of fraud': Congress on Delhi govt's education model
273.article_body: The Congress party on Saturday said the education model being promoted by the AAP-led Delhi government is a "model of fraud". The party added that if the "so-called education model" is replicated in other states, the entire education system will be "ruined". Congress claimed that its government built 150 schools in Delhi whereas Arvind Kejriwal's government hardly built 20 schools.

274.title: 30-yr-old man strangles live-in partner to death in Thane; arrested
274.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly strangling his 24-year-old live-in partner to death in Bhiwandi town of Thane district in Maharashtra. He was arrested by police while transporting the woman's body in an ambulance. The accused has been identified as Saddam Sharif Sayyed, a resident of Kalyan.

275.title: Must 'deal decisively': Iran's Prez on protests over Amini's death
275.article_body: Iran must "deal decisively with those who oppose the country's security and tranquillity", Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said on Saturday while speaking about the protests which erupted following the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini. She was allegedly assaulted by Iranian police over "improper hijab". At least 35 people have been killed in demonstrations against Amini's death across Iran.

276.title: Hyderabad to become 1st city to treat 100% sewage by 2023: KT Rama Rao
276.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao monitored the progress of the construction of Sewage Treatment Plants (STPs) across various sites in Hyderabad on Saturday. "STPs with 1,259 MLD (Million Litres per Day) capacity of treatment will be completed by summer 2023, making Hyderabad probably the first city to treat 100% of its sewerage," he tweeted, sharing photos from the site.

277.title: CBI launches massive crackdown on child porn, raids 56 places across India
277.article_body: The CBI on Saturday raided 56 places across 19 states and one Union Territory in the country as part of a massive crackdown on child pornography. The raids were carried out as part of two cases of circulation of Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM), officials said. They were conducted based on inputs from Interpol Singapore.

278.title: Ankita was killed for refusing 'special services' to resort guests: U'khand Police
278.article_body: Uttarakhand DGP Ashok Kumar on Saturday said 19-year-old Ankita Bhandari, who was allegedly murdered by ex-BJP leader Vinod Arya's son Pulkit, was being pressured to provide 'special services' to guests. She was killed after she refused to provide the 'services', Kumar said. Ankita's friend has reportedly alleged that Pulkit, the resort's owner, was pressuring Ankita to have sex with guests.

279.title: Britannia appoints Rajneet Kohli as CEO, elevates Varun Berry as Executive VC & MD
279.article_body: Britannia Industries' board announced the appointment of Rajneet Kohli as Executive Director and CEO effective September 26, 2022. It also elevated Varun Berry to Executive Vice-Chairman and Managing Director with immediate effect. In his career spanning over 25 years, Kohli has served in senior leadership roles in Asian Paints and Coca-Cola and is joining Britannia from Jubilant FoodWorks.

280.title: Rohit's ability to play against fast bowling is second to none: Karthik
280.article_body: Commenting on India captain Rohit Sharma's 20-ball 46* in second T20I against Australia, India batter Dinesh Karthik said his teammate played brilliantly. "His ability to play against fast bowling is second to none...that's what makes him truly special as a batter," he added. Rohit was adjudged 'Player of the Match'. He hit four fours and four sixes during his knock.

281.title: 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans raised at PFI protest in Pune; probe on
281.article_body: A video of protesters purportedly raising "Pakistan Zindabad" slogans during a protest by the Popular Front of India (PFI) in Pune has surfaced online. Pro-Pakistan slogans were reportedly heard when protesters were taken into custody and made to sit in a police vehicle outside the District Collector's office on Friday. Pune Police said they are investigating the matter.

282.title: I changed a lot after working with Irrfan Khan: Tabu
282.article_body: Actress Tabu said in an interview that she changed a lot after working with Irrfan Khan. The duo shared screen space in films like 'Maqbool' and 'The Namesake'. Tabu added, "It's like those people who come into your life and redefine it and make you see things differently. I learnt to be completely true to my characters and myself."

283.title: Anupam shares video of niece singing song from 'Hichki', says 'She's autistic'
283.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a video of his niece, Tanvi, singing 'Teri Dastaan' from the film 'Hichki' for him and other family members at a gathering. Along with the video, Anupam wrote that she's autistic. "My [sister's] daughter #Tanvi (Autistic) has...most beautiful smile in the world! She...sings with abundant joy...Enjoy the song and bless her," he wrote.

284.title: 1 worker killed, 3 injured in factory blast in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
284.article_body: A 60-year-old worker, Bhagwati Singh, was killed and three others were injured after a blast at an acetylene manufacturing factory in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Saturday. The explosion reportedly took place at JK Enterprises on Jalandhar road during the refilling of cylinders. Technical experts had been called to determine the cause of the blast, Deputy Superintendent of Police Surinder Pal said.

285.title: 2 killed as typhoon hits central Japan; thousands without power
285.article_body: Typhoon Talas struck central Japan on Saturday, unleashing torrential rains and severe winds that left tens of thousands of households without power, as per local media. Two deaths due to the storm were also reported. Wind speed at the centre of the typhoon was recorded at about 65 km/h with peak gusts of about 90 km/h, Japan's meteorological agency informed.

286.title: He's going to break people's toes: Kaneria after Bumrah's bowling in 2nd T20I
286.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah following his performance in India's six-wicket win against Australia in second T20I, Danish Kaneria said the India pacer is back on track. "Opposition teams must beware, as he's looking in a great rhythm...He bowled an excellent spell under pressure. He's going to break people's toes at...T20 World Cup," he added. Bumrah posted bowling figures of 2-0-23-1.

287.title: PM Modi selectively quoted by western leaders: Russia on 'not an era of war' remark
287.article_body: Russian Ambassador Denis Alipov has reacted to PM Narendra Modi's "not an era of war" remark to Russian President Vladimir Putin, which was lauded at the UN. He said, "Western leaders who quoted the...remarks on Ukraine...conveniently picked out parts of that conversation that suits their rhetoric." He added that Russia also wants a peaceful resolution in Ukraine.

288.title: Doctor dies after car hits bike taxi in Hyderabad; 1 arrested
288.article_body: A doctor died on Saturday after being injured in a road accident in Hyderabad's Malakpet on Tuesday night. Dr Sravani, a resident of Hasthinapuram, was on her way to Malakpet on a bike taxi when a car hit the vehicle. The taxi driver and Sravani sustained injuries. The car driver, who escaped from the site, was taken into custody later.

289.title: Activating Starlink: Musk to Blinken on internet shutdown in Iran
289.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said he is activating satellite internet service, Starlink, amid internet shutdown in Iran over protests. Musk was responding to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's tweet that the US took action "to advance internet freedom and the free flow of information" to Iranians. US issued guidance to expand internet services to Iranians despite US sanctions.

290.title: Centre's various decisions based on Gandhian philosophy: VP Dhankhar
290.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday asserted that various decisions of central government were based on Gandhian philosophy. The philosophy of 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vishwas, Sabka Vikas and Sabka Prayas' is a Gandhian thought and rises above "all politics", he stated. "The Mahatma's soul will be satisfied" as government ensured two doses of coronavirus vaccine during the pandemic, he added.

291.title: SSB jawans fought and wiped out Naxalism in Bihar & J’khand: Shah
291.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the role of Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) and said that Naxalism has been finished in Bihar and Jharkhand due to the efforts of jawans. "Naxalism is on the brink of ending in the Bihar and Jharkhand regions...We can even say it is finished here," Shah said.

292.title: Congress 'aged', it will be AAP vs BJP in Gujarat: Raghav Chadha
292.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Saturday said that the Gujarat elections will be a direct contest between his party and the BJP. He dismissed Congress as an "aged" party that hasn't won in almost three decades. "After a 27-year rule of the BJP, now is time for a change, time for the Arvind Kejriwal model of governance," said Chadha.

293.title: MVA govt didn't function as per Bal Thackeray's principles: Maha minister
293.article_body: Maharashtra minister Dadaji Bhuse on Friday criticised former CM Uddhav Thackeray and claimed that the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government did not function as per the principles and teachings of Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray. Only the Congress and NCP benefitted from the alliance, Bhuse added. He was addressing a group of Shiv Sena workers from CM Eknath Shinde's faction.

294.title: Dhoni was open to everyone's suggestions: Harbhajan on India's 2007 T20 WC win
294.article_body: Recalling Team India's 2007 T20 World Cup win on its 15th anniversary on Saturday, Harbhajan Singh said it didn't feel to the team that MS Dhoni was the captain before he took the trophy as everyone was giving their suggestions. "He was very open to it and would let us go ahead with whatever we thought was best," he added.

295.title: Cong is playing 'dirty politics': K'taka CM on PayCM campaign
295.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai accused the Congress of playing "dirty politics" in connection with its PayCM campaign in the state. "They should give evidence, records and it has to be investigated. Without anything in their heads, they come to the session. This shows their moral degradation. This campaign is taken without any morality and mudslinging programme," said Bommai.

296.title: Patna HC stays demolition of Sultan Palace, seeks reply from Bihar govt
296.article_body: Patna High Court stayed the proposed demolition of Sultan Palace, commonly known as Parivahan Bhawan, and sought a reply from the Bihar government. This comes after a PIL was filed by a Patna-based lawyer. Bihar government had earlier granted approval for the construction of three five-star hotels in Patna, including one at the site where the Sultan Palace is built.

297.title: MP man stabs 7-yr-old 12 times, says he was helping her meet her parents
297.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Indore reportedly killed his seven-year-old neighbour on Friday. According to the police, the accused abducted the girl, who lost her parents a few years back, took her to his house and stabbed her at least 12 times. "The man said he was trying to help her as she wanted to meet her parents," police said.

298.title: Bankrupt crypto firm Voyager's CFO to quit months after appointment
298.article_body: Cryptocurrency lender Voyager Digital, which filed for bankruptcy in July, announced on Friday that its Chief Financial Officer Ashwin Prithipaul is stepping down from his role and would leave after a "transition period". This comes within months of his appointment in May. Voyager said its Chief Executive Officer Stephen Ehrlich will head the role of the CFO in the interim.

299.title: Ghaziabad man's adopted daughter suspected of killing him
299.article_body: A 14-year-old girl has been identified as the prime suspect in her adoptive father's murder case in Ghaziabad. The man was found dead at his home in Vaishali Sector 4 on Thursday, police said. The deceased and his adopted daughter had a strained relationship over a rape case that was filed against the latter's friend, police said citing his wife.

300.title: Yes Bank to exit Reconstruction Scheme after lock-in period ends
300.article_body: Yes Bank said on Friday it has amended the July 15 announcement regarding its exit from the Reconstruction Scheme, 2020 after receiving clarification from the RBI. The bank said the RBI would allow it to exit the scheme, which it entered in March 2020, after the end of a three-year lock-in period for 75% of shares held by existing shareholders.

301.title: Some investors pull out of Digital World's plan to buy Trump's app
301.article_body: Blank-cheque company, Digital World Acquisition, said some investors are backing out of its plan to acquire former US President Donald Trump's social media firm Truth Social. Investors, who signed the private investment in public equity commitment, have terminated nearly $139 million in investments of $1 billion commitment. Digital World didn't disclose the investors who pulled out investments.

302.title: 28-yr-old man strangles wife to death over argument in Thane, held
302.article_body: A 28-year-old man, Anil Laxman Lokhande, was arrested for allegedly strangling his 25-year-old wife, Meena, to death at their house in Thane's Kalwa over an argument, police said on Saturday. The couple used to frequently fight and the accused strangled his wife in the early hours of Friday, senior inspector Manohar Awhad said.

303.title: Unichem gets ₹270 cr from Sekhmet for 19.97% stake sale in Optimus
303.article_body: Drug firm Unichem Laboratories on Friday said it received ₹270 crore as the first tranche of payment from Sekhmet Pharmaventures Private Limited for the sale of 19.97% equity shares in Optimus Drugs Private Limited. A consortium of private equity funds, led by PAG, had announced in May that it will acquire a controlling stake in Optimus Drugs for ₹2,000 crore.

304.title: Australia's 2nd largest telco Optus contacts customers after data leak
304.article_body: Australia's second-largest telecommunications company said it was contacting "all customers to notify them of the previously announced cyberattack's impact, if any, on their personal details". "We will begin with customers whose ID document number may have been compromised, all of whom will be notified by today...No passwords or financial details have been compromised," Optus said.

305.title: Inspired by crime TV show, 3 people rob Mumbai celebrity dentist of ₹12 lakh
305.article_body: Three people have been arrested for allegedly stealing ₹12 lakh from a celebrity dentist in Mumbai. Reports said that the accused were inspired by a crime television show. The three also stole ornaments and expensive watches, as per reports. Police were able to catch all three accused after scanning over 500 CCTV footages.

306.title: Woman constable felicitated for saving life at Hyd's Gymkhana during stampede
306.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand felicitated woman constable, Dawa Naveena, who administered CPR to a woman injured in the stampede outside Gymkhana Ground. "I didn't hesitate and immediately administered CPR to the woman for a few minutes and the woman started breathing," 2020 batch recruit Naveena said. She was awarded with an appreciation certificate and a cash reward of ₹5,000.

307.title: We shouldn't always equate fun with money: Google CEO to staff amid cost-cutting
307.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai held an all-hands meeting with employees amid cost-cutting and cultural changes at the company. Upon being asked about the withdrawal of some perks, Pichai said, “I remember when Google was small and scrappy...We shouldn’t always equate fun with money...You can walk into a hard-working startup and people may be having fun...it shouldn’t always equate to money."

308.title: Clip shows Scarlet Witch's deleted action scene from Doctor Strange 2, video viral
308.article_body: A video is going viral on social media showing a deleted action scene from 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness'. Scarlet Witch, portrayed by Elizabeth Olsen, can be seen engaged in hand-to-hand combat using magic and puppeteering a dead soldier. A social media user commented, "We were robbed," while another wrote, "It's amazing...but...was probably too violent for the studio."

309.title: Unstable coalition govts affected India's image for decades: PM Modi
309.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said for many decades in the country, coalition governments were formed that were unstable. "Nobody trusted India for anything," he added. "Eight years back, in 2014, alert voters formed a majority government. As a result, a stable government was formed. This led to...change in policy-making too," he said, adding, "World now trusts us more."

310.title: Prices of leafy veggies surge in Navi Mumbai; bunch of coriander costs ₹70
310.article_body: After heavy rainfall impacted the supply of green vegetables in most parts of Maharashtra, the prices of leafy vegetables surged. The price of a bunch of coriander leaves increased to ₹70 in Navi Mumbai, and traders believe there will be no respite for at least a fortnight. As per Agricultural Produce Market Committee, vegetable supply has decreased by around 30%.

311.title: BMC to screen 40 lakh citizens for TB, leprosy in Mumbai from Sept 26
311.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will conduct a tuberculosis and leprosy detection campaign from September 26, where civic teams will engage in doorstep visits and screen over 40 lakh residents. "If a person is found to have symptoms of TB, then their sputum will be examined and X-rays will be done free of cost," BMC executive health officer said.

312.title: Over 60 booked in Pune for holding protest over raids against PFI
312.article_body: Pune City Police have booked more than 60 persons for holding a protest without permission against the raids on the Popular Front of India (PFI). "We've registered an offence against more than 60 persons, including 41 who were detained yesterday...for unlawful assembly...blocking the road," police said. Police had given a notice to the organisers not to hold any protest.

313.title: Anticipatory bail granted to ex ADG (Law and Order) in cheating case
313.article_body: The Delhi High Court granted anticipatory bail to the former ADG (Law and Order) of Haryana in a cheating case registered in 2016 against a private company and its directors and employees. The court said that the accused has no previous antecedents against him. The bail order asked the accused to furnish a personal bond of ₹50,000.

314.title: Perhaps you're 'too much' angry with me: Punjab Guv to CM Mann
314.article_body: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann stated that state Governor Banwarilal Purohit's office seeking details of an Assembly session  was "too much", Purohit wrote to Mann, saying, "Perhaps you are 'too much' angry with me." He asked Mann to read Articles 167 and 168 of the Constitution and added, "I think your legal advisors are not briefing you adequately."

315.title: K'taka man dies of heart attack after son held over suspected terror links
315.article_body: A man died of a heart attack in Karnataka's Shivamogga after his 22-year-old son was arrested on suspicion of having links with terror outfits. The deceased was reportedly upset with his son's arrest. His body was taken from Mangaluru to Thirthahalli in an ambulance by his relatives where the last rites were performed.

316.title: Assam CM, Sadhguru to take part in three-day 'Chintan Shivir'
316.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma, along with all the ministers and senior secretaries of the government, will be attending a three-day 'Chintan Shivir', which is set to begin today. They will be discussing the ongoing activities of the departments and chalk out a strategy for the next five years. Spiritual leader Sadhguru will also take part in the shivir today.

317.title: Petrol bomb hurled at RSS member's house near Chennai
317.article_body: A petrol bomb was thrown at RSS functionary Seetharaman's home in Tambaram, near Chennai, Tamil Nadu. "We heard a loud sound and saw fire outside around 4 am. We thought it was a short circuit, but it wasn't the case. We doused the fire and called police officials. They got the footage of the accused," Seetharaman said.

318.title: Brahmāstra witnesses 240% one-day jump at box office on National Cinema Day
318.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra' witnessed a 240% one-day jump at the box office on National Cinema Day on Friday. As per trade sources, the Ayan Mukerji-directorial earned ₹11 crore nett in all languages on Friday from just over ₹3 crore the previous day. Most theatre chains and halls sold tickets at flat ₹75 on National Cinema Day.

319.title: Pic of Novak Djokovic coaching Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer in Laver Cup goes viral
319.article_body: A picture of Novak Djokovic coaching Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer during their doubles match in Laver Cup has gone viral on social media. The match was Federer's last of his professional career. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "The most beautiful sight in tennis!" Another wrote, "So lucky I got to see these three play!"

320.title: Virat Kohli's reaction to crowd chanting 'RCB, RCB' goes viral
320.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli's reaction to crowd chanting 'RCB, RCB' during the second T20I against Australia in Nagpur has gone viral. In the video, Kohli can be seen pointing towards the BCCI  badge on his training jersey. All-rounder Harshal Patel can also be seen pointing towards the BCCI badge in the video.

321.title: He was a little reserved during shoot: Sharib on 'Vikram...' co-star Hrithik
321.article_body: Actor Sharib Hashmi, opening up about his experience of working with Hrithik Roshan in 'Vikram Vedha', said he was "a little reserved" during the shoot. "I didn't have much interaction," he said. Sharib, however, added Hrithik is a "chilled person" and doesn't have an attitude. "When we'd packed up, he came and told me...he liked working with me," Sharib said.

322.title: Most beautiful sporting pic ever: Kohli on pic of Nadal crying during Federer's farewell
322.article_body: Virat Kohli shared a picture of Rafael Nadal crying during Roger Federer's farewell on Instagram and said, "Who thought rivals can feel like this towards each other." Kohli added, "This is the most beautiful sporting picture ever for me...Nothing but respect for these two." Federer, who played his career's last match at the Laver Cup in London, was also emotional.

323.title: He just hands himself over to you: Sudhir on working with Nawaz
323.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra spoke about working with Nawazuddin Siddiqui in the movie 'Serious Men' and called his experience "wonderful". "He just hands himself over to you and he's this perfect," he added. The film, which was released in 2020, also featured Nassar and Shweta Basu Prasad. 'Serious Men' was based on the book of the same name by Manu Joseph.

324.title: BJP supporters built temple of UP CM Yogi to capture barren land: SP
324.article_body: The Samajwadi Party (SP) has claimed that Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's temple near Ayodhya was built by "BJP supporters" to "capture" a barren land owned by an individual. The party called BJP "the biggest land mafia". It also shared a video showing a man alleging that his nephew constructed the temple on his (the man's) land without his permission.

325.title: PFI has major plans to trigger unrest in India: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
325.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said the Popular Front of India (PFI) has large-scale plans to trigger unrest in country. "PFI has now adopted a new modus operandi. It was working towards creating communal tension," Fadnavis added. He further claimed that raids at PFI premises across the country show that there was adequate proof with NIA and ATS.

326.title: Dhoni did so well for India despite having no technique: Kiran More
326.article_body: Former Team India selector Kiran More said MS Dhoni did so well for India despite having "no technique". "I give a lot of credit to [ex-Team India coach] Greg Chappell, the way he moulded Dhoni and used him in the right place," added More. "Dhoni showed the world how the game can be played...with a great mind," he stated.

327.title: Body of unidentified woman found floating in a lake in Thane
327.article_body: The body of an unidentified woman was found floating in the Makhmali Talao lake in Thane, Maharashtra on Saturday morning. A team of the fire brigade and personnel from Naupada Police Station as well as the Regional Disaster Management Cell reached the spot and recovered the body, an official said. The woman was presumably around 50 years old, he added.

328.title: Netflix dismisses copyright suit against 'Unofficial Bridgerton Musical'
328.article_body: Netflix has dismissed a copyright infringement lawsuit against the creators of 'The Unofficial Bridgerton Musical', a Grammy-winning album based on Netflix's show 'Bridgerton'. The suit was filed after a sold-out performance of the musical at Washington DC's Kennedy Center in July. Abigail Barlow and Emily Bear, the creators of the musical, had initially started posting about the album on TikTok.

329.title: BJP MLA's car vandalised in Rishikesh over Ankita Bhandari's murder
329.article_body: Locals protesting over the murder of 19-year-old receptionist Ankita Bhandari vandalised BJP MLA Renu Bisht's car in Uttarakhand's Rishikesh on Saturday. The MLA was escorted away by police. Three persons, including former BJP minister Vinod Arya's son Pulkit Arya, have been arrested on charges of murder of Ankita. Locals also set ablaze the resort owned by Pulkit, where Ankita worked.

330.title: 2 drug peddlers arrested in Hyderabad; items worth ₹2 lakh seized
330.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested two drug peddlers including a foreign national on Friday. They also seized ₹2 lakh worth of items including 17 grams of MDMA, two cell phones and cash. One of the accused has been identified as 50-year-old Anthony Boateng Amihere, who is from Africa but resides illegally in Bengaluru. Another accused is a resident of Andhra Pradesh.

331.title: Video of fight at Kanpur hospital surfaces online, UP Police respond
331.article_body: A video of a fight between people at Aashvi Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur was shared by a Twitter user. The user said that some miscreants came from outside and beat up the hospital staff. Uttar Pradesh Police, while replying to the tweet, directed the Police Commissionerate of Kanpur Nagar to take necessary action.

332.title: Delhi-Noida drive may become signal-free with Chilla elevated road
332.article_body: The Noida Authority has sought funds of ₹650 crore to restart the construction of the Chilla elevated road that will make Noida-Delhi drive signal-free. The road will connect Sector 14A Chilla regulator near Mayur Vihar in Delhi to Noida's Mahamaya flyover. Its construction was earlier halted due to National Green Tribunal's objection to pollution, COVID-19 pandemic, and lack of funds.

333.title: We laughed, cried, celebrated with you: Laver after Federer's last match
333.article_body: Following Roger Federer's last career match at Laver Cup in London, Rod Laver took to Twitter and wrote, "Retirement comes to all at some stage, but it seems the greater the player, the harder the moment. That was hard, Federer." He added, "We laughed, and cried, and celebrated with you, and we'll continue to do so for a long time."

334.title: India-Bhutan border gates reopen for tourists after 2.5 years
334.article_body: The India-Bhutan border gates in Assam were reopened for tourists on Friday after two and a half years, an official said. The border gates, which were closed amid the coronavirus pandemic, have been reopened with some new rules along with a sustainable development fee, the official added. The gates will stay open between 9 am and 5 pm.

335.title: National Cinema Day sets new record with over 65 lakh cinegoers
335.article_body: National Cinema Day saw a record of over 65 lakh estimated cinema-goers on September 23, confirmed the Multiplex Association of India (MAI). Over 4,000 screens participated in the initiative with cinema operators reporting housefull shows throughout the day. Some theatres had shows starting at 6 am due to unprecedented demand for movie tickets, reported Free Press Journal.

336.title: Sylvester Stallone, wife Jennifer Flavin reconcile a month after she filed for divorce
336.article_body: Actor Sylvester Stallone and former model and his wife Jennifer Flavin have reconciled a month after she filed for divorce. "They decided to meet back up at home, where they talked and were able to work out their differences," the couple's spokesperson said. The couple have been married for 25 years and are parents to three daughters.

337.title: 'K.G.F' director Prashanth Neel is fabulous with actors: Shruti Haasan
337.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan has stated that the director of 'K.G.F' series Prashanth Neel is fabulous with his actors. "It's nice to work with a director who is so clear-headed about their vision...He really creates this world and it is our job as actors to melt into his world," the actress added. She will be seen in Prashanth's directorial 'Salaar'.

338.title: I was quite surprised: Rohit on his 20-ball 46* in 2nd T20I vs Aus
338.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said he was "quite surprised" with his unbeaten 46 off 20 balls in the second T20I against Australia. "I didn't expect it to go quite as well as that," added Rohit. "When you're playing a game like that, you can't plan too much. You...have to play the situation and use conditions to your advantage," he stated.

339.title: Some are unhappy to see me happy: Neha after criticism on 'Maine Payal...' remake
339.article_body: Singer Neha Kakkar said some people are "unhappy" seeing her "happy and successful" and she felt "sorry" for such people, after facing backlash over her song 'O Sajna'. "Please keep commenting. I won't even delete them because I know and everybody knows what Neha Kakkar is!" she said. 'O Sajna' is a remake of Fulguni Pathak's 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai'.

340.title: PM Narendra Modi to launch 5G services in India on October 1
340.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will launch 5G services in India on October 1 at India Mobile Congress, touted to be Asia's largest technology exhibition. Earlier in August, the Department of Telecom received total bids worth ₹1.50 lakh crore from the spectrum auction. Reliance Jio, Adani Group, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea were the four major participants in the spectrum auction.

341.title: Thanks for loving 'Chura Ke Dil Mera': Shilpa on 28 years of 'Main...'
341.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Friday took to Instagram Stories to celebrate 28 years since the release of 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari'. She shared footage of the song from the film, writing alongside, "Thank you for loving 'Chura Ke Dil Mera'." The song was recreated for the 2021 film 'Hungama 2' which marked Shilpa's comeback to films after nearly 15 years.

342.title: Gurugram roads flooded after heavy rain; Twitter users share pics, videos
342.article_body: Gurugram roads were flooded after heavy rainfall lashed the city and its surrounding areas on Friday and Saturday. Several Twitter users shared pictures and videos of the flooded roads. One user called Gurugram "Delhi's very own Bengaluru". Another one said this is the condition of the city every year after rains.

343.title: 2 shepherds die trying to save lamb that fell into borewell in UP
343.article_body: Two shepherds, aged 22 and 55, died of suffocation while trying to rescue a lamb that had fallen into a borewell in UP's Mathura on Friday, said police. One of the shepherds got down into the borewell first and when he did not return, the other went after him. Their bodies were pulled out after a two-hour operation.

344.title: Man seen struggling to stand on road 'due to drugs' in Punjab; video surfaces
344.article_body: A video of man struggling to stand allegedly under influence of drugs in Punjab's Amritsar is being widely circulated on social media. This comes days after a video showed a woman struggling to stand on a busy street in the city allegedly because of drugs, following which police launched an investigation.

345.title: Neighbours call my house 'Sita ka ghar'; I've always felt mother's guilt: Shweta
345.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari has stated that she had always felt the mother's guilt, especially when her daughter Palak was growing up. "Whatever time I would get...would get wasted because of my messed up situation in my personal life," she added. Shweta further said that the neighbours call her house 'Sita ka ghar' because their house is full of ladies.

346.title: Govt issues advisory for IT workers, warns of fake job rackets in Thailand
346.article_body: The Centre issued an advisory regarding fake job rackets targeting IT professionals. MEA said that missions in Thailand and Myanmar detected instances of "fake job rackets offering lucrative jobs to entice Indian youths for the posts of 'Digital Sales and Marketing Executives' in Thailand". It added, these rackets are being operated by firms involved in call-centre scams and cryptocurrency fraud.

347.title: OnePlus offers deals on entire 5G portfolio
347.article_body: OnePlus has announced festive offers on its entire 5G portfolio including its newly launched OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition at a discounted introductory price of ₹32,999. OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition offers a free 3-month Prime membership, an exchange bonus of ₹3,000*, and more. The brand has also announced exciting offers on other products including Smart TVs, Audio and Wearables.

348.title: India's forex reserves drop to $545.65 bn, lowest since Oct 2020
348.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell to their lowest level since October 2, 2020, RBI data showed. The reserves fell by $5.2 billion to $545.65 billion as of September 16. This is the seventh weekly fall in the forex reserves and it is because of a decline in foreign currency assets by $4.69 billion to $484.90 billion, the data showed.
