349.title: Delhi LG alleges ₹20 cr fraud in Jal Board headed by Sisodia, seeks FIR
349.article_body: Delhi LG Vinai Kumar Saxena sought an FIR against officials of Delhi Jal Board (DJB), headed by Manish Sisodia, claiming an "embezzlement" of ₹20 crore. LG directed Chief Secretary to identify the accused and submit a report within 15 days. DJB allegedly collected ₹20 crore as bills from consumers and sent it to a private bank account for several years.

350.title: I was sexually harassed by producer on 'Fresh Off the Boat' set: Constance Wu
350.article_body: Actress Constance Wu, known for portraying Rachel in 'Crazy Rich Asians', has revealed that she was sexually harassed by a producer on the sets of 'Fresh Off the Boat'. She said that the producer touched her thigh and grazed her crotch in 2015. "I thought...'I don't have to stain this Asian American producer's reputation...the reputation of the show'," Constance said.

351.title: I once drove behind Salman Khan's car to get a glimpse: Dulquer
351.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has revealed that he once drove behind actor Salman Khan's car to get a glimpse of the latter, adding he could see him sitting in the front seat. "We were hoping he would get down from the car so we could see him...I have not met Salman sir till date," the actor said.

352.title: I try to get into a player's shoes, getting angry doesn't help: Dhoni
352.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni said he always tries to get into the shoes of his players to figure out the reason behind a dropped catch or misfield. "Getting angry does not help...If a player is 100% attentive...I don't have a problem," added Dhoni. "Of course, I...want to see how many catches he took during practice," he stated.

353.title: Locals set U'khand resort on fire after body of 19-yr-old receptionist found in canal
353.article_body: After body of Ankita Bhandari, a 19-year-old receptionist who worked at former BJP Uttarakhand minister Vinod Arya's son's resort, was found in a canal in Uttarakhand, locals set the resort on fire on Saturday. Three people including the BJP leader's son, Pulkit Arya, have been arrested in the case. A Special Investigation Team has also been set up.

354.title: CBI conducts nationwide raids against online child sexual abuse
354.article_body: The CBI on Saturday carried out raids across 56 locations in 19 states and one Union Territory against the circulation of child sexual abuse material online, said officials. Code-named 'Operation Megha Chakra', the crackdown came following inputs from Singapore Interpol. The operation is targeted at cloud storage facilities used to circulate videos of illicit sexual activities involving minors.

355.title: Mother leaves 4-yr-old girl alone in locked house in Chandigarh, booked
355.article_body: Police have booked a woman for endangering the safety of her four-year-old daughter by leaving her alone in a locked house in Chandigarh. The incident occurred in August 2021 at Sector-29 where the woman had been living with her parents due to a marital dispute. A complaint was filed by the girl's father who found her locked inside the house.

356.title: Pune girl critical after father fires gun during fight with mother
356.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was critically injured after her father allegedly fired a gun during a fight with her mother at their home in Pune, police said. The girl's father was arrested and the gun, for which he has a licence, was also seized. "The girl was admitted to...hospital. [Doctors] operated on her earlier this morning," DCP (Zone-3) Pornima Gaikwad said.

357.title: Doctors remove nail cutter from 8-month-old baby's throat in Nashik; pics surface
357.article_body: Doctors in Maharashtra's Nashik removed a five-cm-long nail cutter from the throat of an eight-month-old baby who swallowed it accidentally. "Initially, we were not able to get a good grip on the nail cutter. During the process, it had slid a little further but after a 30-minute procedure, we were eventually able to remove the object," a doctor said.

358.title: U'khand BJP leader expelled from party after son held in receptionist's murder case
358.article_body: The BJP on Saturday expelled Vinod Arya and Ankit Arya, the father and brother of main accused Pulkit Arya, in connection with the murder of 19-year-old receptionist Ankita Bhandari who worked at Pulkit's resort. Pulkit has been arrested along with two staff members. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami announced setting up an SIT to probe the incident.

359.title: I was crushed after a troll said I bought my State Award: Dulquer
359.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said that a troll once told him, 'Hey, want to sell your (State) Award? I will pay you 500 bucks more than what you paid for it.' He added that he was crushed at the time. Dulquer won the Kerala State Award in 2016. "[Someone] told me...'Do not ever not enjoy [your awards]'," the actor added.

360.title: Set up cardiac support facility on court premises: HC to Delhi govt
360.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed the national capital's government to install advanced cardiac life support (ACLS) facility on its premises before December 6. The court gave the order in a 2018 suo motu petition on basic life support system requirements in public places. Moreover, the court directed Delhi Metro to set up ACLS facilities at all major interchange stations.

361.title: Why confuse Rahul and cloud his imagination?: Shastri on Kohli opening
361.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli potentially opening the innings in the T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "I wouldn't want that...KL Rahul is batting beautifully at the top." "Why cloud his imagination? Why confuse him? Why sow a seed in his mind that he might not be opening? You don't want that," added Shastri.

362.title: SP shares videos of BJP MLAs playing game, eating tobacco inside Assembly
362.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) tweeted two videos taken inside the UP Assembly. In one of the videos, Mahoba BJP MLA Rakesh Goswami can be seen playing a mobile game inside the Assembly and in another, Jhansi BJP MLA Ravi Sharma can be seen eating tobacco. "These people don't have answers to citizens' issues...turned the Assembly into an entertainment hub," SP wrote.

363.title: 38-yr-old man murders 75-yr-old man after fight over sharing food in Nagpur
363.article_body: A 38-year-old man killed a 75-year-old man after two fought over sharing food in Nagpur. An official said that the two had earlier consumed liquor at the spot. Following the fight, the accused hit the victim on the head using a wooden stick and killed him. The accused has confessed to killing the man.

364.title: The big openings of 'Sanju', 'Brahmāstra' are not because of me: Ranbir
364.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has stated that the opening numbers of 'Sanju' and 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' are not because of him. "I have that much sense that...'Sanju'...was a Rajkumar Hirani film, it was a biopic on Sanjay Dutt. That's really a star-proof, actor-proof setup...'Brahmāstra'...had Alia and my pairing, Nag sir. It had so much going for it," he said.

365.title: Pant should play orthodox cricket, he's been lost in experiments: Hayden
365.article_body: Ex-Australia opener Matthew Hayden said he'd like to see Rishabh Pant play more orthodox cricket, adding he's been "lost in experiments" for a long time. Hayden stated that he'd pick Pant over Dinesh Karthik in India's lineup for T20 World Cup 2022. "It's so key to have power hitters...who can hit the ball long. Pant's got that versatility," he said.

366.title: Nitish not PM candidate but facilitator in uniting Oppn: JD(U) chief
366.article_body: JD(U) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is not a PM candidate and that he only wants to be a facilitator in uniting the Opposition. "With the unity of...Opposition, India can be free from BJP," Singh added. He also criticised BJP for misusing central agencies, claiming that the party is ending the trustworthiness of established institutions.

367.title: UP policeman gets life term for shooting lawyer dead on court premises
367.article_body: A 43-year-old Sub-Inspector was sentenced to life imprisonment on Friday for shooting a lawyer dead on the premises of an Allahabad court in 2015. According to the prosecution, Shailendra Singh shot advocate Nabi Ahmed following an altercation. Another accused, Rashid Siddique, who was booked on charges of criminal conspiracy, was acquitted by the Raebareli court.

368.title: Railways gets real-time train tracking system built with ISRO help
368.article_body: Indian Railways on Friday said it is installing a Real-Time Train Information System (RTIS) on locomotives to track their movement. The system, built in collaboration with the ISRO, is capable of providing "mid-section updates with a periodicity of 30 seconds", and tracking location and speed of trains without any manual intervention. The RTIS devices have been installed in 2,700 locomotives.

369.title: Manmohan Singh extraordinary but India stalled during UPA-era: Narayana Murthy
369.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy recently spoke about delays in decision-making during the Congress-led UPA's regime. He said, "I used to be on the board of HSBC in London (between 2008 and 2012)...During Manmohan Singh's government, who's an extraordinary individual, for whom I have tremendous respect, somehow India stalled. Decisions were not taken quickly, everything was delayed."

370.title: Barclays sued by shareholders over $17.6 bn debt sale blunder in US
370.article_body: Barclays' shareholders sued the British lender in a proposed US class action claiming they had suffered losses in connection with the bank's sale of $17.6 billion more debt than regulators had allowed. The authorised amount was $20.8 billion. Barclays revealed in March that it sold $15.2 billion more structured and exchange-traded notes, which was raised by $2.4 billion in July.

371.title: UP testing ground for every scheme formulated by Centre: Yogi
371.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that with a population of 24-25 crores, the state acts as a testing ground for every scheme formulated by the Centre. "If any welfare programme bears positive results in Uttar Pradesh, it's set to have a positive impact on all...other states," he added. Adityanath was addressing a conclave in Lucknow.

372.title: U'khand CM orders probe by SIT after 19-yr-old receptionist's body found in canal
372.article_body: After the body of a missing 19-year-old receptionist, at former Uttarakhand minister and BJP leader Vinod Arya's son's resort, was recovered from a canal on Saturday, Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said that he is "pained by the heartbreaking incident". The Chief Minister said that a Special Investigation Team has been formed and an in-depth probe has been ordered.

373.title: AR Rahman, Aishwarya Rai travel in economy to promote 'Ponniyin Selvan: I'
373.article_body: Composer AR Rahman and actors Aishwarya Rai, Vikram and Trisha Krishnan flew from Hyderabad to Mumbai for the promotions of Mani Ratnam's directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan: I'. They could be seen travelling in the economy class of the plane. A social media user commented, "How come this isn't business class or a private jet?" while another wrote, "We love a budget."

374.title: 21-hour Haryana highway blockade ends after farmers' demands met
374.article_body: Farmers in Haryana on Saturday morning lifted the blockade on the Delhi-Ambala National Highway near Shahabad in Haryana's Kurukshetra after their demands were met, Bhartiya Kisan Union (Haryana) chief said. The farmers had blocked the highway for over 21 hours. "We had talks with the district administration and they've ensured that paddy procurement will start immediately," the BKU chief added.

375.title: Sachin Pilot only alternative after Ashok Gehlot as Raj CM: Congress MLA
375.article_body: Congress MLA Rajendra Singh Gudha has come out in support of Sachin Pilot for the post of Rajasthan Chief Minister. "In my understanding, after Gehlot sahab, there is no alternative in Rajasthan apart from Sachin Pilot sahab," he told reporters on Friday. Gudha, who along with five other BSP MLAs switched to Congress in 2019, also met Pilot on Saturday.

376.title: Lost peace of mind, wish I hadn't won so much money: Kerala auto driver on ₹25cr lottery
376.article_body: Days after winning a ₹25-crore lottery in Kerala, auto-rickshaw driver Anoop said, "I've lost all peace of mind." He said he's being mobbed by people seeking financial help and asking him to sort out their various needs. "I have to keep changing houses...I haven't even got the money. I now wish I had not got so much money," he added.

377.title: SRK's role in 'Brahmāstra' had Iron Man-like tonality: Ayan Mukerji
377.article_body: Speaking about Shah Rukh Khan's role in 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva', Ayan Mukerji said, "The tonality of that scene is a little bit Iron Man-like." He added that they always thought Vanarastra will exist in the world of science which is why the character is a scientist. "Shah Rukh Khan is kind of a hero cracking jokes," he said.

378.title: Man stuck between train & platform rescued in TN; video goes viral
378.article_body: A video of a man being rescued by Railway Protection Force (RPF) officers and Government Railway Police officials after he got stuck between a train and the platform at Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore railway station has gone viral. The video was shared by RPF India on its Twitter handle with the caption, "Yet another story of Bravery and Courage!"

379.title: SC to hear BJP MP Manoj Tiwari's plea on firecrackers ban on Oct 10
379.article_body: Supreme Court will hear a plea filed by BJP MP Manoj Tiwari against the Delhi government's decision on the firecrackers ban on October 10. "In the name of the Right to life, freedom of religion cannot be taken away," Tiwari's plea said. Delhi government banned the storage, sale and use of all types of firecrackers till January 1, 2023.

380.title: IndiGo charges Olympic medalist PR Sreejesh for 41-inch hockey stick, he shares post
380.article_body: Indian men's hockey team goalkeeper PR Sreejesh, who was a part of the team that won a bronze medal at the Tokyo Olympics, took to Twitter after IndiGo charged him extra for his baggage. He tweeted, "FIH [allows] me to play with a 41-inch hockey stick, but IndiGo never [allows] me to carry anything over 38-inch...Pay extra ₹1500 for...goalkeeper baggage."

381.title: Irrfan Khan was very kind to actors, he was chill: Dulquer Salmaan
381.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan recently spoke about late actor Irrfan Khan, saying that he was very kind to actors. He added that actors can be selfish and only care about getting their scenes right but Irrfan was "chill". "He will be like 'Hey, I might just say something here' [or] 'I might throw something here...giving you a heads up'," Dulquer said.

382.title: Elephant’s ivory teeth only for show: Digvijaya Singh on RSS chief
382.article_body: Reacting to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat’s visit to a madrassa in Delhi, Congress leader Digvijaya Singh compared his meeting with the ivory teeth of elephants, which are only for show. "Wherever innocent Muslims have been persecuted by your workers, apologise to them and get them justice. Then only, we will believe that the RSS is thinking differently," said Singh.

383.title: No Change of Guard Ceremony today due to weather: Rashtrapati Bhavan
383.article_body: The Change Of Guard ceremony, which takes place every Saturday at the forecourt of Rashtrapati Bhavan, will not take place today due to inclement weather conditions. The change of guard ceremony is a military tradition that is held every week to enable a fresh group of the President's bodyguards to take the charge.

384.title: Being outsider in Bollywood helped me not get carried away: Sonali
384.article_body: Speaking about being an outsider in Bollywood, actress Sonali Bendre said that she was used to being an outsider because of being born into an Army family. "It also kept me grounded because I didn't get so carried away with what was happening to me," she added. The actress further said that it was easier to adapt to new situations.

385.title: First pic of UK King Charles carrying out duties with official 'Red Box' released
385.article_body: UK King Charles has been pictured with his official Red Box in which the British monarch receives government documents. The photo was released by the Buckingham Palace along with the old pictures showing Queen Elizabeth II with the Red Boxes. "Queen Elizabeth received Red Boxes, which were made upon her Coronation in 1952, almost every day," the statement read.

386.title: 30 students fall sick after eating food in mess at Pune university
386.article_body: About 30 students at Pune's MIT Art, Design and Technology (ADT) University fell sick after allegedly eating food from the mess on the campus. The university's officials denied the allegations and claimed that the students had eaten food outside the campus which led to the illness. The registrar said that students who fell sick have minor food poisoning symptoms.

387.title: Wipro announces annual increment for employees, covers 96% staff
387.article_body: Wipro announced an annual increment to eligible employees for the financial year ended March 2022 and they will get it with their September salaries. The firm has covered around 96% of employees under this round of annual increments. Wipro had held back variable pay to its mid and senior-level executives for the June quarter due to pressure on operating margins.

388.title: Faith in judiciary vindicated: Uddhav on Dussehra rally permission
388.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday welcomed the Bombay High Court's order which allowed his faction to hold the annual Dussehra rally in Mumbai's Shivaji Park on October 5. Adding that it's the state government's responsibility to maintain law and order during the rally, he further said, "Our faith in the judiciary stands vindicated."

389.title: BYJU'S clears $234 million payment to Blackstone for Aakash deal: Report
389.article_body: BYJU'S has paid $234 million to Blackstone it owed to the private-equity firm for the $950 million acquisition of Aakash, as per a report. The payment was for a stake of about 38% owned by Blackstone in Aakash. While closing the deal, BYJU'S had reportedly paid all Aakash's shareholders, except Blackstone as the firm had agreed on deferred payment.

390.title: I don't read reviews, don't like dissection of films: Alia Bhatt
390.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt stated that she doesn't read film reviews even when they are good, adding she reads the headlines people send her sometimes. She added she doesn't like "this sort of dissection on day one or day 10 also of a film". "You generally get a sense of what worked and what didn't after the film's release," she said.

391.title: Cryptocurrency exchange ZebPay's CEO quits, to start own venture
391.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange ZebPay's CEO Avinash Shekhar has resigned from his post and will now work on his own startup, which will operate in the Web 3.0 and crypto tax compliance space. According to Shekhar's LinkedIn profile, he started working with ZebPay in July 2017 as CFO before becoming the Co-CEO and later the CEO in December 2021.

392.title: Woman who accused BJP leader of rape gets 1 week to file documents
392.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday granted a week's time to file documents to a woman who has accused BJP leader and former Union minister Shahnawaz Hussain of raping her. Some "material facts" relating to the alleged offence have been concealed by the BJP leader's counsel, the woman's lawyer claimed. "We will list the matter on October 12 for hearing," SC said.

393.title: Supreme Court's online RTI portal almost ready: Justice Chandrachud
393.article_body: The Supreme Court will soon have an online RTI portal, assured a bench headed by Justice DY Chandrachud on Friday. "The portal is almost ready," said Chandrachud while hearing a PIL seeking a mechanism to file RTI applications online. Calling it a valuable thing, the judge further said the move can be emulated by the high courts.

394.title: Star kids like Varun Dhawan, Suhana Khan work really hard: Juhi Chawla
394.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla said that star kids like Varun Dhawan and Suhana Khan work really hard. "None of them takes it lightly that I am a star kid so I'll just arrive on sets and things will happen," she added. The actress further said that she can never say who is her favourite because she has seen them growing up.

395.title: 45-yr-old man dies of electrocution on waterlogged road in Gurugram
395.article_body: A 45-year-old man died after getting electrocuted by a live wire protruding from an electric pole in Gurugram on Thursday night. According to police, Swami Chopra couldn't spot a pit on the road due to waterlogging and drove into it. He then fell into the ditch and got electrocuted by the wire, police added. Chopra was a resident of Sector-37D.

396.title: Punjab Guv seeks Assembly session details; CM says, 'It's too much'
396.article_body: After Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit's office sought details of legislative business to be taken up during an Assembly session called by state government on September 27, state CM Bhagwant Mann said, "[It's] too much." "[Governor/President's] consent before any session of legislature is...formality. In 75 years, no President/Governor ever asked [for] list of legislative business," Mann added.

397.title: After day's rest, Rahul Gandhi resumes Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala
397.article_body: After a day's rest, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday resumed the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra from Kerala's Perambra. The 17th day of the 'yatra' started around 6:30 am and the night stay will be at Thope Stadium. On Friday, a medical camp was organised at Chalakudy for those participating in the march.

398.title: Country claiming to seek peace won't shelter 26/11 attack planners: India to Pak at UN
398.article_body: India has criticised Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif for his remarks at the UNGA. The first secretary of the Indian Mission to the UN, Mijito Vinito said, "A polity that claims it seeks peace with...neighbours would never sponsor cross-border terrorism…Nor would it shelter planners of the horrific Mumbai terrorist attack, disclosing their existence only under pressure from the international community."

399.title: Influencer facing 6 yrs jail in Russia for using Instagram; shares pic of her crying
399.article_body: Russian fashion influencer Veronika Loginova has said she's facing six years in jail for using Instagram. According to Russian digital rights NGO Roskomsvoboda, the 18-year-old is the first individual to be prosecuted after a Russian court banned Instagram and Facebook for "extremist" activities in March. She posted pictures of her crying and documents allegedly sent to her by Russian prosecutors.

400.title: 3 arrested for shooting at man, robbing delivery boy in south Delhi
400.article_body: Police have arrested three men for allegedly shooting and injuring a person, minutes before they robbed a food delivery boy of his bike and cellphone in south Delhi's Neb Sarai area on Thursday. According to police, the men shot the victim over some previous enmity. Police also recovered a pistol, knife and the stolen bike and cellphone from the accused.

401.title: Roads waterlogged, trees uprooted in Delhi after heavy rains; IMD issues yellow alert
401.article_body: The India Meteorological Department issued a 'yellow' alert for Delhi on Saturday. The Delhi Traffic Police took to Twitter to share a list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging in the city. The police also said that trees have been uprooted in several areas including areas near Shivaji Stadium, Dilshad Garden and Kalkaji main road.

402.title: 5 arrested over fine on Dalit family for touching idol in Karnataka
402.article_body: Police arrested five people for imposing a fine of ₹60,000 on a 15-year-old Dalit boy's family for touching an idol of a village deity in Kolar. The boy had touched the idol during a religious procession on September 8, police said. "We will offer our prayers to Dr BR Ambedkar," the boy's mother had said earlier.
